About the Work

The Geomatics Office (SFN) provides Geomatics content, functional management, and analysis to ensure GEOINT accuracy. SFN’s mission is to enable GEOINT accuracy through geodetic, geophysical, and photogrammetric sciences and content. SFN’s functions include the following:

Provide for maintenance and currency of World Geodetic System 1984 (WGS 84) content, to include the WGS 84 reference frame, the World Magnetic Model, Earth Gravitational Model, and controlled imagery.
Provide functional management for all users of Geomatics content. Provide datum transformations, coordinate conversions and other geodetic analysis to ensure that all GEOINT is interoperable with WGS 84.
Provide and maintain required Geomatics content in the form of Foundation GEOINT Focus Group (FG) surfaces including topographic elevation, gravity, geotechnical soils and crosscountry mobility.
Provide multi-sensor, geodetic, geophysical, geotechnical and photogrammetric analysis. Provide geodetic and geophysical survey support to IC and DoD.
Provide controlled imagery content, functional management, and develop delivery mechanisms to support targeting and FG needs in line with the agency vision.
Advises, assists, leads, manages, works and/or supports Business Operations; development, review, coordination, adjudication, promulgation, communication of measurable business processes; Subject Matter Expert development, coordination and maintenance of all assigned process and procedures; SME development, coordination and maintenance of all process diagrams, SOPs, Checklists, etc.; automate and visualize business processes. Participate in NGA planning activities with Mission Partners, and development contractor sponsored Integrated Product Teams (IPTs) and working groups. Develop and update business plans, advocacy briefings, and schedules in accordance with agency policy. Develop and coordinate Mission Plans and agency approval documentation.

Your Duties

Assist the National Center for Geospatial Intelligence Standards (NCGIS) and NGA’s Source Operations & Management Office (SF) in the development and maintenance of World Geodetic System (WGS) and Geomatics standardization artifacts for topics related to geospatial information including Space, imagery, and imagery intelligence.
Support the NCGIS and SF with developing and documenting WGS and GEOMATICS standardization artifacts required for the end-user in the collection, production, dissemination, and exploitation of GEOINT.
Serve as Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to the World Geodetic Systems and Geomatics – Focus Group (WGSG FG) and the Geospatial-Intelligence Standards Working Group (GWG) providing guidance as to the mandating of WGS and Geomatics standards in the DoD IT Standards Registry (DISR) and the IC Standards registry (ICSR).
Serve as consultants for GWG in defining life-cycle requirements for WGS and Geomatics standards and assist in the development of Technical Standards.
Coordinate efforts with the GWG, the WGSG FG, SFN Senior Leadership, Transformation and Content Management Office (CMO) points of contact, Domain Leads, Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), Information Technology Services Directorate (T) personnel, and Online GEOINT Services (OGS) personnel.
Assist in the:
development, documentation, and maintenance of domain-specific standardization artifacts.
Standardization artifacts consist of but not limited to; standards, implementation profiles, product specifications, handbooks, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Instructions, and implementation guidance.
Artifacts are required for GEOINT collection, production, and dissemination and promote interoperability with applicable DoD, IC, and international standards.
Coordinate activities across focus groups (FGs) as applicable, and provide guidance to the NSG/NGA with respect to implementation and compliance criteria.
Support the development of web capabilities, enabling online, on-demand access of standardization products.
Assist with the development and maintenance of Intellipedia and IntelDocs pages in support of online, on-demand efforts and Standards development.
Ensure compliance to web services architecture for the NSG, NGA, DoD, IC, Federal sector, as well as international defense and civil standardization development organizations and standards setting organizations.
Incorporate program metrics, analyst progress/performance metrics, resource management, and project milestones and timelines where possible.
Perform internal and external briefing in a clear and concise manner to communicate information to Senior Leadership, Standardization Community and Local SMEs
Assist SMEs in communicating complex topics to layperson(s).

Required Skills and Experience

Top Secret SCI (TS/SCI) Security Clearance
US Citizenship
Demonstrated experience in troubleshooting and problem identification.
Demonstrated experience with web-based collaborative platforms such as SharePoint.
Demonstrated experience facilitating and communicating with Subject matter experts to produce official documentations.
Demonstrated experience in building complex formulas within Microsoft Excel to extract data from large spreadsheets.
Demonstrated experience with Adobe PDF software.
Demonstrated experience with Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft SharePoint and Microsoft Team
Demonstrated experience briefing clear and concise information to conveying project progress and innovations.
Demonstrated experience to interpret or seek an understanding of complex topics or ideas.

Desired Skills

Demonstrated experience with Geospatial Intelligence Standards such as working groups, registry and committees.
Demonstrated experience publishing to registries to Intelligence Community (IC) or Department of Defense.
Demonstrated experience (in one of the skill sets) with Geodesy, Selenodosy, Global Positioning System (GPS)/Global Navigation Satellite System (GNSS), Geodetic survey, Geophysical data, Terrain data, Photogrammetry, Imagery data, or GIS.
Demonstrated experience with database design, relational model building, or practical knowledge of applicable data/information management or presentation standards to support Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) compliance or Business analytics
Demonstrated experience integrating data from legacy systems.

The ERP Business Analyst position will focus on ERP implementation of the warehouse software system- S2K, which will assist HUB in the profitable achievement of goals via data-driven analytics that support and guide a best-in-class sales and operations team.




The individual in this role will be responsible for both input and output from S2K, utilizing the platform to source and implement data that will lead to achieving HUB’s strategic growth plan. This includes generating internal and external insights that support the Sales team with fact-based data—supporting the Operations and Finance teams with Category and SKU analysis and rationalization. Lastly, this role is for an innovative visionary who aspires to develop E-Commerce profitable achievement of goals, and for aligning effective sales and operations objectives with overall strategy.

ERP knowledge: Able to align the ERP implementation with business objectives and KPIs, manage expectations regarding budget, and resources needed to implement any contingency plans necessary enabling HUB to become more efficient and effective.
ERP implementation: Lead the implementation of an ERP system within a wholesale business. Understanding and aligning the ERP implementation with our business objectives and KPIs, managing expectations regarding budget, resources, and contingency plans.

Business analysis: Possess excellent business analysis skills to identify problems and find solutions. Ability to analyze data and make informed decisions to communicate these ideas in a presentation that will support the Sales and Operations Teams.
Project management: Possess excellent project management skills to keep projects on track, drive change management initiatives, and educate users.
Communication: Possess excellent communication skills to lead ERP implementation and future upgrades.
Collaboration: Collaboration is key and part of HUB Culture. An ERP Systems Analyst should be able to work with different business units and develop trust to ensure that the system is implemented successfully, holding the key stakeholders accountable.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree required.
3- 5 years experience in system data analytics and project management.
IBM Cognos experience preferred.
A strong business acumen and experience leading a team.
Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solutions and recommendations.
Ability to deliver KPI results.
Must be able to work with a diverse workforce, suppliers, and customers.
Travel required to all HUB locations, retailers, and industry events as needed.

Business Analysis

Develop a strong understanding of key operational processes and workflows, including the key business drivers behind those processes.
Facilitate effective discovery sessions and techniques to uncover specific business needs and requirements. Understand unique differences across regions and project teams.
Partner closely with individuals and teams to consider new and better ways to apply technology to drive greater business outcomes (improved efficiency, safety, quality, profitability, etc.).

Coordinate cross-functional data needs between the Financial and Operations teams


Solution Design

Solutions can represent new or existing technology platforms and tools, critical enhancements or changes to existing technologies, systems integration efforts, or custom technology solutions.
Evaluate solution designs and implementations from vendors and internal partners. Recommend optimal options for project groups based on objective measures and alignment with enterprise goals.


Project Planning, Execution, and Change Management

Execute mindful project planning for each technology initiative, including resource planning, schedule, key milestones, risk mitigation, issue management and ongoing communication.
Seek to execute the projects in an agile, highly collaborative manner which meets or beats project timeline while maintaining quality. Maximize value creation for McCarthy throughout project execution.

Develop training content based on best practices established for application capabilities.


Internal/External Relationship Management

Develop partnerships with key stakeholders within external technology vendors, including implementation resources, customer success representatives, and product teams.

Alltru Credit Union, a certified Great Place to Work, isn’t just another job. It’s a career with a cause! Our employees are a driving force in helping people achieve their financial dreams! And we’re growing! Our Data Analytics team is seeking a dynamic and innovative Data Analyst; someone that is passionate about member service, and knowledgeable in all facets of data analyzation. Are you an accomplished Data Analyst with three (3) years of financial analysis experience? Are you well versed with gathering and analyzing data? Does optimizing statistical efficiencies bring you joy? If you possess and promote a highly positive, member-service attitude with the ability to achieve high levels of performance, then Data Analyst at Alltru might be the next step in your professional career!

Reporting to the Project Development & Member Insight Manager, as the Data Analyst, you will gather and analyze data in support of business cases and build high quality predication systems to ensure our products and services deliver on our mission to our members. You will also conduct data analysis of the individual credit union as well as the overall industry to deliver key conclusions for comprehensive business recommendations.

Working with employees, and industry partners, our Data Analyst plays an instrumental role in delivering on our mission to our members: Save you money. Make you money. Save you time. That’s why we exist. This is achieved by successfully developing, implementing, and administering all aspects of the credit union’s data activities.

Our Data Analyst will be successful in:

Enhancing organizational data by acquiring secondary and third-party data sources and maintaining databases and data systems.
Developing a deep understanding of systems and processes to extract insights from existing data while identifying and recommending enhancements to improve data quality.
Performing and interpreting both ad-hoc and programmed analysis and present findings in a clear and succinct manner.
Utilizing data visualization tools to report and deliver analysis.
Processing, cleaning, and verifying integrity of data.
Must have an aptitude for understanding program languages such as R or Python, Cache object script, VBA, & SQL.
Assisting in the deployment of predictive analytics models for production use.
Researching industry trends - collect data on members, competitors and marketplace and consolidate information reports and presentations to achieve actionable initiatives.
Serving as analytical partner and provide analysis of credit union operations upon request. This includes researching, gathering, and interpreting data to present recommendations.
Performing project management tasks such as gathering requirements, scope definition and functional testing as needed.

The ideal candidate possesses:

Three (3) or more years of financial industry experience as a business analyst, programmer or financial analyst is strongly preferred.
A bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Information Technology or Business is required.

Are you a passionate, highly motivated, Data Analyst ready to share your knowledge and expertise with our Data Analytics team? Apply today and join Alltru as our new Data Analyst.

Job Location:

This position is with the Office of Administration, Information Technology Services Division (OA-ITSD), supporting the virtual Centers of Excellence and reporting to the Shared Services Manager.




ITSD Core Values - We Innovate and Partner with Passion, Respect, and Integrity United as #OneTeam.

What you’ll do:



Be the ‘go-to’ person for AEM and Docusign COE teams.
Collaborate with the COE Application Development teams to help translate business requirements into scalable and efficient technical solutions.
Collaborate with the COE Application Development teams to help identify and resolve issues/bugs, provide guidance, etc. for the successful adoption and growth of AEM as an enterprise tool.
Collaborate with agency partners to help identify new Docusign implementations and provide guidance for the successful adoption and growth of Docusign as an enterprise tool.
Assist with end-user training for COE Application Development teams and agency partners.
Develop and execute test plans to ensure the quality and reliability of the AEM tool.
Perform form reviews to ensure that appropriate policies, standards, and best practices are followed.
Apply communication skills, problem-solving skills, and knowledge of best practices to collaborate with COE Application Development teams and agency partners.
Collaborate with the COE application development team to create and maintain policies, processes, best practices, training guidelines, etc.
Build, maintain, support, and enforce ITSD policies to guide the consistent development within the COE including guidelines for compliance requirements, and establishing governance processes that all ITSD teams will utilize

A unique blend of strategic thinking, creativity, technical proficiency, and operational excellence.

An ability to communicate effectively and tactfully, both verbally and in writing, with the COE team, agency partners, and leadership.
In-depth knowledge of Agile, Scrum, and Waterfall methodologies.
Working knowledge of Azure DevOps (ADO).
Passionate & Customer Focused.
Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and work well in a team environment.

DUTIES: Under general supervision, exercising a high degree of independent judgment and skill on problems frequently of a complex and confidential nature, to participate in the development, maintenance, and enhancement of business applications. In this capacity, as assigned, to undertake such work as: Provide business analysis and programming expertise within an assigned business unit/area, usually as a member of a project team, in the analysis, design, and development of business applications. Responsibilities may include support of systems through essential services. Provide technical consulting support on project or system issues. Evaluate application software packages and make recommendations to management or other project leaders as assigned. Participate with other IT members, customers, and other stakeholders in new product reviews, tests, and pilots. Formulate and define system scope and objectives through research and fact-finding to develop or modify moderately complex information systems to solve business problems. Regularly coach other project personnel, including on-site and remotely located vendor/contractor personnel, in most phases of applications systems analysis and programming activities to ensure business application systems are developed in a way that complies with architectural standards and established methodologies and practices. Prepare detailed specifications from which programs will be written and ensure production and quality of applications meets specifications of operational schedules and business activities. Devise or modify procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating time and form of desired results. Develop or modify application programs from detailed specifications. Code, test, debug, and document programs. Develop and maintain application interfaces, reports, conversion programs, and custom functionality. Identify conflicting business practices and integration issues, recommending alternative solutions. Monitor and report to management or other assigned project leaders on the status of project efforts, anticipating/identifying issues that inhibit the attainment of project goals and implementing corrective actions. Develop business relationships and integrate activities with other IT departments to ensure successful implementation and support of project efforts. Foster and maintain good relationships with customers and IT colleagues to meet expected customer service levels. Special assignments, both recurring and non-recurring, in connection with IT operations.
SPECIAL RESPONSIBILITIES: For holding as confidential information relating to Company operations. For proper care of equipment, data, and supplies. For adherence to departmental operating requirements.
CONTACTS: With all levels of employees in various departments of the Company.
QUALIFICATIONS: Candidates must satisfy at least one of the following three qualifications: 1. Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business Administration, Mathematics, or equivalent computer related degree from an accredited college or university, with a minimum of 12 credit hours in computer programming and analysis/design courses. The computer related courses require a minimum grade of C, with a minimum overall grade point average of 2.5 on a scale of 4.0 or 3.5 on a scale of 5.0. At least five years of experience in programming/analysis. Internal candidates must receive an overall exceptional performance rating on the previous two years' performance appraisals, and must receive a favorable recommendation from one or more supervisors. 2. Associate’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business Administration, Mathematics, or equivalent computer related degree from an accredited college or university, with a minimum of 12 credit hours in computer programming and analysis/design courses. The computer related courses require a minimum grade of C, with a minimum overall grade point average of 2.5 on a scale of 4.0 or 3.5 on a scale of 5.0. At least seven years of experience in programming/analysis. Internal candidates must receive an overall exceptional performance rating on the previous two years' performance appraisals, and must receive a favorable recommendation from one or more supervisors. 3. At least ten years of directly related experience in lieu of academic requirements. Internal candidates must receive an overall exceptional performance rating on the previous two years' performance appraisals, and must receive a favorable recommendation from one or more supervisors. Preference is given to candidates with specific business area knowledge for the position being filled. Advancement to this classification is based on business need.

Job Title: Business Analyst- Cash Product & Banking Services
Job Description:
Summary

This role is a member of the Cash Management and Banking Services team, which is responsible for Brokerage Cash Management Accounts, the Bank Sweeps Program, Stifel Bank Deposit Accounts, Credit Cards programs and the Firm’s payments strategy. This will require partnership with Bank Operations, Brokerage Operations, Financial Advisors, and client support teams in support of shared clients and a seamless client experience.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

This person is a subject matter expert in all things deposits and payments with the ability to articulate functionality to clients, sales, operations and vendors alike.
A guardian of the client experience this role partners with Private Banking, Digital Solutions, Bank Operations, Brokerage Operations, Marketing and Client Services teams to ensure superior digital delivery, superior product setup and superior operational execution.
Works at the intersection of business and technology, tasked with identifying and articulating business needs and turning them into business requirements and functionality to bridge our business teams and our technology teams/vendors.
Requires ability to work directly with clients at their locations or via WebEx or phone in support of setup and advance support situations.
Works closely with vendor-partners in the identification of best-of-breed products and services and then coordinating/leading cross-functional teams for both the technical and operational implementation and support.
Reviews, edits and at times creates business processes and procedures related to the products and services as a way to build and retain institutional knowledge.
Interviews, investigates and communicates with clients and internal stakeholders to determine what is and is not working. Takes ownership, prioritizes appropriately, and proposes business and technical solutions to solve issues.

Qualifications

Clearly communicates in verbal and written forms potentially complex issues or concepts.
Ability to get up to speed quickly, identify patterns, trends, and gaps on any given topic or situation.
Passionate learner of new concepts and willing to tackle uncertainty with enthusiasm.
The ability to recognize when meaningful action is required and assume the additional responsibility needed to tackle the challenge at hand.
Able to take ownership, prioritizes appropriately, and propose business solutions to solve issues

Education & Experience

Bachelor's degree required or equivalent experience.
2+ years' related experience in financial services required. Previous experience working with financial advisors or clients in a wealth management setting preferred.

Systems & Technology

Proficient with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook.
Understands client/server computing architecture, user interfaces, and application programing interfaces.
Understand concepts related to relational databases. Ability to write SQL queries is preferred but not required.

About Stifel

Stifel is a more than 130 years old and still thinking like a start-up. We are a global wealth management and investment banking firm serious about innovation and fresh ideas. Built on a simple premise of safeguarding our clients’ money as if it were our own, coined by our namesake, Herman Stifel, our success is intimately tied to our commitment to helping families, companies, and municipalities find their own success.

While our headquarters is in St. Louis, we have offices in New York, San Francisco, Baltimore, London, Frankfurt, Toronto, and more than 400 other locations. Stifel is home to approximately 9,000 individuals who are currently building their careers as financial advisors, research analysts, project managers, marketing specialists, developers, bankers, operations associates, among hundreds more. Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.

At Stifel we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental and vision care, 401k, wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off.

Stifel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

ABOUT US AND ABOUT YOU

Clinician Nexus enables health care organizations to build thriving clinician teams with industry-leading technology products, workforce and compensation analytics, and automated workflow solutions. Backed by extensive technical expertise and industry-leading data, we deliver innovative approaches to help clients to plan, educate, and engage their clinical workforce at every stage of the lifecycle. We are committed to providing our clients with outstanding guidance and support as they focus on shaping the future of health care.

The Business Systems Analyst sits within Clinician Nexus Customer Success. In this role, you will assist in analyzing client business requirements for the product, recommending automated system controls, and testing/validating product functionality.

PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES


Helping to determine operational objectives, gather information, and evaluate output requirements.
Working closely with end-users (internal and external) to analyze, define, model, and document system requirements.
Assisting with identifying project milestones, phases and elements, while also keeping the team on time and within budget.
Constructing workflow charts and diagrams, studying system capabilities, and writing specifications.
Building client-specific rules within product, testing data, and validating results.
Assisting with creating end-user documentation (e.g., user guides, process flow charts, training materials, etc.) and delivering training.
Providing client support.
Participating in and leading product and report releases.
Position requires on-call and some weekend and after-hours commitment

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Bachelor's degree in data analytics, statistics, or related field.
Knowledge of the health care industry and/or finance is preferred.
A minimum of one year of experience with gathering systems' requirements and analyzing data is required.
Solid technical knowledge and experience working with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills.

BEHAVIORAL ATTRIBUTES

Ability to present ideas in a business-friendly and user-friendly language and respond to client and/or survey respondent inquiries.
Self-starter with demonstrated ability to successfully assist with complex project deliverables in a very driven and dynamic organization.
Demonstrated ownership of assigned tasks and dedication and perseverance to get the job done.
Flexibility, adaptability, and the ability to work under tight deadlines or changing needs.
Confidence and ability to work independently.
Exceptional employee service orientation.
Strong attention to detail.
High level of self-motivation.

SALARY, BENEFITS AND PERKS

Reflected below is the base salary range offered for this position. Actual salaries may vary depending on factors including but not limited to academic achievements, skills, and experience. The range listed is just one component of the total rewards package offered to candidates.

$65,770 - $109,620
Competitive total rewards package
Medical and dental coverage at no premium cost for employees
401(k) and profit-sharing retirement plans
Flexible spending accounts
Generous paid time off (PTO)
Federal and company holidays
Gender-neutral parental leave
Bereavement and pet leave
Continuing education and professional accreditation sponsorship
Life and AD&D insurance
Short-and long-term disability
Employee assistance program
Mental health support program

Demonstrates ability to interact comfortably with Senior Leadership and/or Government Executives and staff on a day-to-day basis

Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skills

Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution

Job Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst - Identity Access Management
Job Description:
At Edward Jones, we help clients achieve their serious, long-term financial goals by understanding their needs and implementing tailored solutions. To ensure a personal client experience, we have located our 15,000+ branch offices where our more than 7 million clients live and work.

In a typical branch office, a financial advisor meets with clients and receives branch office support, so they can focus on building deep relationships with clients. Headquarters associates in St. Louis, Tempe and Mississauga provide support and expertise to help U.S. and Canada branch teams deliver an ideal client experience. We continue to grow to meet the needs of long-term individual investors.
Team Overview:
The Identity & Access Management team is responsible for enabling capabilities to govern the access lifecycle of our Financial Advisors and Home office associates across our application and infrastructure landscape. Our key capabilities include Identity Governance & Administration, Privileged Access Management, Single Sign-On, Federation, Multifactor Authentication, API Security, & Directory Services. We are responsible for supporting and enhancing our existing systems and developing technology solutions that support and enhance the technology division in alignment with the Firm's vision.

What You'll Do...
The Identity and Access Management (IAM) Sr. Business Analyst is responsible for partnering with functional leaders from across the organization to build new identity solutions with an approach that emphasizes speed, value creation, and innovation. As part of this continuous value creation loop, we are looking for an individual that can analyze and translate business requirements and ultimately support our Identity & Access Management team with brining new solutions & experiences to life.

The Sr. Business Analyst will review, analyze and evaluate end-user needs as defined by strategic goals of the product team, along with querying and analyzing data, to create user stories and system specifications.
Assist in the creation of department program governance processes and meeting facilitation (dashboard creation, status tracking, coordination with internal and external department stakeholders)
Support Product Owners and Product Management in feature writing, story writing, and requirements gathering
Create, maintain and review business process models, business decision documents, requirements, use cases, and test cases
Coordinate dependencies and interfaces between different product teams and systems
Balance activities across multiple projects of moderate to high complexity at the same time
Perform data analysis that facilitates the transformation of complex data/information into actionable insights to support highly complex business processes using agile methodology
Execute and present written and verbal business systems impact analysis
Liaison between product team and stakeholders to proactively identify opportunities to create, maintain, enhance, or integrate existing and new solutions
Understanding and communication of cross divisional systems and impacts of change
Generate communication, process, and educational plans to mitigate the disruption of change
Responsible for business case development and presentation of new systems and solutions
Build and maintain working relationships throughout the Firm
Identify and make suggestions for improvements when problems and/or opportunities arise
Assist with PowerPoint presentation creation and polishing for a wide range of audiences
Support user acceptance testing through test case generation, template creation, and result tracking
What Experience You'll Need...
Degree Preferred
Bachelor's Degree in Management Information Systems, or similar field
Technical Skills
Knowledge of the SDLC process for software and solution development
Familiarity with SAFe / Agile frameworks and knowledge of product management roles and responsibilities (Product Owner, Scrum Master, RTE, Product Manager etc.)
Basic familiarity with technology and / or IAM solutions & capabilities (e.g. Authentication, Identity Governance and Administration, Single Sign On)
Strong organizational skills to effectively prioritize tasks and manage personal workload

**Candidates that live within in a commutable distance from our Tempe, AZ and St. Louis, MO home office locations are expected to work in the office three days per week, with preference for Tuesday through Thursday"**

POSITION SUMMARY

The Financial Operations Lead Analyst will work in Financial Operations and will be responsible for reviewing the setup, payments and reconciliation reporting for clients’ Financial Pricing and Rebate guarantees. This position may be required to assist in processing payments and reconciliation reporting during periods of high volume. The Analyst will prepare and/or review financial statement accruals. The position requires leading regular communication with cross functional areas in order to meet deadlines, including Client Pricing, Account Teams, IT, Audit, etc. Business Analysts will be required to support requests and participate in discussions directly with clients and/or consultants. The ability to communicate requests, results and issues effectively with team members, management and cross functional areas is essential. The successful candidate will also be expected to proactively contribute to driving and developing best practices across the Financial Client Operations team, and lead system user access testing and special projects.

Review clients’ financial pricing and rebate guarantee setups, payments, and reconciliation reports.

Directly support requests and setup/reporting for key accounts.

Address service requests from business partners, audit and clients/consultants. Lead cross-functional communications.

Lead system user acceptance testing and special projects.

Assist Clients, Strategic Relations, Account Management, MRA Management and/or Accounting with issue resolution by providing data analysis and special reporting requests.

Internal and External Audit assistance.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelors degree in Business, Mathematics, Accounting, Finance.

2+ years of relevant work experience.

Experience in PBM, Pharmaceutical, or Healthcare industry preferred.

Strong analytical, planning, problem identification and resolution skills required.

Control oriented and strong organizational skills.

Proficiency in SQL and Excel, writing and manipulating queries.

Effective communication with internal and external individuals in various functional areas and at all levels of management.

Experience with Contract review and execution.

Understanding of and experience with quality and process improvement concepts, methodologies.

Proven ability to plan for and integrate multiple tasks concurrently as well as work independently.

Job Title: Business Process Integration Business Analyst II
Job Description:
Summary

The Business Integration Business Analyst II will coordinate the development of small to large scale projects from conception to implementation. This position will analyze, design, and document system requirements with business area(s) sponsoring the project. Acts as the liaison between business owners, technical analyst, IT and application vendors throughout the project.




Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Direct and manage development for small to large scale projects and ongoing enhancement requests.
Track project deliverables using appropriate tools by identifying and managing project dependencies and critical path.
Present reports defining project progress, risks, problems and solutions.
Work directly with technical analysts, IT and application vendors to transform and develop design requirements throughout all phases of the project from system design to implementation.
Analyze business processes and data to help determine how new technology can satisfy business needs.
Under limited direction of management, project managers and/or senior team members work closely with technical analyst, IT and application vendor to transform and develop design requirements throughout all phases of the project from design to implementation.
Organize and participate in design review sessions to gather business requirements for new projects, enhancements/improvements to existing functionality, and issue resolution.
Elicit requirements through interviews, business analysis, workflow analysis and data analysis.
Collaborate with business area and technical experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.
Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans.
Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility and conformity to standards.
Develop and manage deployment plans and assist in development and execution of test plan.
Facilitate user integration and acceptance testing of supported applications.
Assist web server administrator with application installation and validation.
Some minimal travel by car and/or air in conjunction with local, regional and/or national travel.

Qualifications

Self-directed requiring minimal oversight and the ability to mentor less experienced staff.
Prior experience with large-scale organizational process improvement efforts desired.
Understand the components involved in running a successful project.
Strong analytical, organizational and project management skills.
Ability to use logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
Knowledge of all phases of software development including requirements analysis, design, testing (integration, user, and performance), implementation and support.
Excellent communication skills with ability to relay information well in both written and verbal form.
Able to recognize potential assignments outside own areas of specialization and apply appropriate business technology related expertise as necessary.
Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.

Education & Experience

Bachelor's degree in Business, Technology, or related field; or equivalent combination of education and professional experience
2+ years' related Analysis experience
Basic SQL database knowledge and query language is preferred

Stifel is a more than 130 years old and still thinking like a start-up. We are a global wealth management and investment banking firm serious about innovation and fresh ideas. While our headquarters is in St. Louis, we have offices in New York, San Francisco, Baltimore, London, Frankfurt, Toronto, and more than 400 other locations. Stifel is home to approximately 9,000 individuals who are currently building their careers as financial advisors, research analysts, project managers, marketing specialists, developers, bankers, operations associates, among hundreds more. Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.

At Stifel we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental and vision care, 401k, wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off.

Position Overview


The RGA HR team is seeking a dynamic and multidisciplinary continuous improvement expert who is passionate about people and business process reengineering. In this role, you will have the opportunity to operate as a subject matter expert for HR business process development to optimize global HR’s effectiveness and delivery of a best-in-class employee experience. You will lead our efforts to execute our strategy for continuous improvement, including the deployment of automation capabilities across the HR function. The HR Automation Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining automation and continuous improvement solutions using Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and other cutting-edge tools to optimize processes across the employee life cycle. This role reports functionally through the HR organization, partnering closely with the Technology function.


Responsibilities

Lead our process improvement and automation efforts across our teams throughout the globe. Work in partnership with process owners to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of our processes and positively impact the employee experience.
Collaborate across the HR organization to understand and anticipate automation and continuous improvement needs
Scope, develop, implement, and maintain citizen development automation capabilities and continuous improvement solutions that meet the highest quality standards and leverage leading
Design and develop RPA solutions using industry-standard tools (e.g., UiPath, Alteryx) to streamline HR processes
Implement process enhancements by configuring workflows, integrating APIs, and creating custom scripts to ensure seamless automation.
Perform thorough testing of automation solutions to identify and rectify any issues, ensuring accuracy, reliability, and compliance.
Monitor and maintain the deployed automation solutions, troubleshooting and resolving issues promptly to minimize disruptions.
Champion the continuous improvement vision and train / enable a “citizen” mindset within our HR community to identify and implement solutions as part of everyday activities.
Manage and maintain the portfolio of automation and continuous improvement initiatives across our function.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, easily move between high-level general understanding and details, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Drive process enhancements and continuous improvement efforts that grow customer (employee) value, create efficiencies across the function, and positively impact the quality of our service and delivery to business leaders.
Partner closely with the Business Enablement function, IT, Data Privacy and others as cross-functional stakeholders to ensure solutions meet specific technical and business capabilities requirements, and to understand local and international regulations that may impact process requirements.

Requirements


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Required:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Human Resources, Computer Science or a related field
1+ years of experience designing and deploying continuous integration environments and platforms, including requirements gathering, process analysis and process modelling experience
Experience working with HR processes and stakeholders throughout the employee lifecycle; global exposure is a plus
Experience documenting business processes, defining requirements, implementing process improvements, and determining what processes are appropriate candidates for automation.

Preferred:

3+ years of experience developing automation solutions
Six Sigma Black or Green Belt
UI Path Certified Business Analyst

SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Required:

Ability to automate business processes and workflows using leading process automation technologies such as UiPath, Blue Prism, Alteryx, etc.
Solid understanding of HR processes and workflows across the employee life cycle.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex processes and identify automation opportunities.
Experience with API integrations, data manipulation, and database management.
Programming / scripting skills for creating custom automation processes.
Natural curiosity for continuous learning to stay current with RPA technology developments and penchant for exploring the “art of the possible”
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Ability to drive projects to completion while considering change management best practices.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with ability to quickly adapt to new methods.
Ability to liaise with individuals across a wide variety of operational, functional, and technical disciplines.
Strong interpersonal, communication, and customer service skills with demonstrated ability to share and impart knowledge.
Experience driving employee engagement through improved digital delivery of HR services.
Project management experience, experience in SCRUM or Agile methodologies is desired.

Job Description:
We're a Little Different

Our mission is clear. We bring to life a healing ministry through our compassionate care and exceptional service.

At Mercy, we believe in careers that match the unique gifts of unique individuals - careers that not only make the most of your skills and talents, but also your heart. Join us and discover why Modern Healthcare Magazine named us in its "Top 100 Places to Work."

Responsible for the administration of the Epic Cogito Application functionality and performance, as well as enterprise-wide development of Cogito reporting tools and engineering of data solutions within Epic Hyperspace. Formulates and defines business scope and objectives as well as Epic Clinical Systems requirements through research and fact-finding combined with an understanding of business and industry requirements

Marshalls appropriate resources to deliver Epic Clinical Systems services in support of project deliverables
Production Support monitoring, troubleshooting, configuring, enhancing and providing advanced customer support

- General understanding of a variety of operating systems- Ability to work in a complex technical environment

Job Title: Senior Data Operations Analyst, Global Financial Solutions
Job Description:
Position Overview


The Senior Data Operations Analyst participates in and supports various Global Financial Solutions (GFS) initiatives related to administration and data integration. This includes working with RGA Valuation, Finance, Pricing, and Risk Management to ensure consistent and quality data extracts are produced. Leads and supports the development and implementation of processes for analyzing, mapping, and testing client data to be used in various downstream processes. Leads and supports the analysis of client reported inventories for new deals and reviews changes to existing deals.


Responsibilities

Serve as technical resource for guiding the team in extracting, loading and mapping of client data
Serve as a subject matter expert when dealing with the most complex issues related to data conversion.
Write and execute data queries to get results needed for analysis, validity and accuracy testing.
Interpret data, analyze results and provides ongoing reporting and analysis of key metrics
Champion the future vision of the department and assist in creation/maintenance of data repository documentation and data standards and guidelines
Solve business problems with a moderate level of complexity; analyze possible solutions using technical experience and judgment and precedents
Explain data research and findings in a clear and straightforward manner to assist leadership in prioritizing business and information needs
Analyze, test, and debug system solutions. Consult with other Operations and Risk Management associates in the development of solutions for specific business needs

Requirements


Education & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Science, Actuarial Science or a related degree, or equivalent experience
3-5 years of experience in a data quality assurance and/or annuity/pension administration system testing role
Progress toward FLMI, ALHC or another relevant professional accreditation would be a desired asset

Skills & Abilities

Intermediate Word, Excel, VBA and SQL/Query skills
Advanced-to-expert knowledge of database application such as Access, SQL Server, or Oracle as well as SQL would be an asset
Advanced level of investigative, analytical and problem solving skills
Detailed oriented, passionate about completing the task correctly rather than quickly
Advanced oral and written communication skills demonstrating ability to share and impart knowledge
Advanced ability to liaise with individuals across a wide variety of operational, functional, and technical disciplines
Familiarity with insurance administrative systems, ability to calculate benefits under multiple structures, and basic understanding of how the data affects liabilities and financial results
Ability to work effectively within a team environment and individually
Advanced ability to translate business needs and problems into viable/accepted solutions.
Advanced skills in customer relationship management and change management
Ability to interpret and understand various client data formats
Broad business knowledge, including knowledge of valuation, finance, and/or administrative systems
Advanced ability to set goals and handle multiple tasks, clients, and projects simultaneously; Ability to appropriately balance priorities, deadlines, and deliverables
Willingness to learn new skills and software applications
Ability to customize a process for testing that can be repeated by others if needed
Ability to liaise with individuals across a wide variety of operational, functional, and technical disciplines

Company Overview



Reinsurance Group of America, Incorporated (NYSE: RGA) is one of the largest global life and health reinsurance companies. With headquarters in St. Louis, Missouri, RGA supports clients and partners around the world through innovative approaches and customized solutions. Founded in 1973, RGA celebrates its 50th anniversary in 2023.

We are the only global reinsurance company to focus primarily on life- and health-related reinsurance solutions.
Our core products and services include life reinsurance, living benefits reinsurance, group reinsurance, health reinsurance, financial solutions, facultative underwriting, and product development.
RGA ranks #222 on the 2022 Fortune 500 list. The list ranks U.S.-based companies by total revenue.
RGA has been named to Fortune magazine’s 2023 list of the World’s Most Admired Companies.
RGA has approximately $3.4 trillion of life reinsurance in force and assets of $84.7 billion as of December 31, 2022.

RGA’s culture stresses high performance and collaboration, and the company hires the smartest people in the industry. And, the smart people they hire are not just number crunchers. RGA values creativity and curiosity. RGA also values humility, and its employees work together without ego to bring value to RGA while revolutionizing the life and health insurance space.

RGA aims to evolve RGA workplaces and the communities in which RGA has a presence, into more diverse, equitable and inclusive environments. We will create a culture where individuals are valued, feel a sense of belonging, and are respected for their differences – a workplace where all employees are encouraged and supported to reach their full potential.

Our individual, social, economic, and cultural identities shape and influence our experiences and perspectives. Therefore, to do our best work RGA will ensure diversity in our workforce across the various dimensions of social, interpersonal, and cultural identity - and by practicing inclusivity in how we work with one another. Inclusion in our workplace is a step towards our purpose of making financial protection accessible to all.

We support hybrid and flexible ways of working and would welcome a discussion on how we can balance what is important to you with business requirements during the recruitment process.

Visit our 2022 Annual Review site, https://rgaannualreview.com, to find out more about us.




The general pay range for this position is $72,340 to $102,725 per year. Base pay varies depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and market location. In addition, RGA provides an annual bonus plan that includes all roles and some positions are eligible for participation in our long-term equity incentive plan. RGA also maintains a full range of health, retirement and other employee benefits.

Job Reference: US08640

Health Capital Consultants (HCC), an established, nationally recognized financial and economic consulting firm based in suburban St. Louis, MO, is expanding and has an immediate full-time career position available for a Business Valuation - Associate Financial Analyst. HCC’s services include: valuation of healthcare enterprises, assets and services in all healthcare sectors; healthcare provider related intermediary services, including, integration, affiliation, acquisition and divestiture, and ACO development; Certificate of Need (CON) and regulatory consulting; financial analysis, including the development of forecasts, budgets and income distribution plans; and, litigation support and expert witness services.

The successful candidate for this full time, career position will assist in all aspects of the analysis of financial and economic data, and will play an integral role in the development of conclusions and opinions, as well as the writing of comprehensive reports related to a diverse range of valuation projects.

Example of Essential Duties Include:

Data Collection – request and organize all data necessary for a specified client engagement

Due Diligence – investigate and present in a clear manner the findings of the entity’s historical operations

Client Financial Analysis – develop meaningful insights based on historical financial statements and discussions with management

Valuation Modeling – performing various financial analyses, excel-based modeling, and deliverable preparation

Industry Research – gathering all relevant information around a particular healthcare segment, new trends (i.e., regulatory, reimbursement, competition, technology, etc.)

Writing – drafting narrative reports in support of our valuation opinions and calculations

Project Management – ability to keep a running schedule of priorities as you manage the engagement process for multiple valuations at once

Communication – provide managers and clients with concise yet comprehensive communication

Minimum qualifications include a bachelor's degree, preferably in finance or economics, and 1-3 years’ experience in a healthcare valuation role, with specific knowledge of compensation/asset valuation. Preferably have worked on a variety of healthcare valuation engagements, as well as have been published or have spoken on industry topics. Candidate should have graduate degree training and/or have obtained or currently working towards obtaining healthcare valuation accreditations such as (ASA, CFA, CVA, CPA/ABV). Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and related programs. Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S.

Attractive salary and benefits package.

Job Title: Business Analyst - Div Mgmt & Support (Kansas City)
Job Description:
Description

Business Analyst – Development and Strategic Investment

The Business Analyst will work closely with their business line director to focus on building and monitoring financial models for project financing options and alternative investments. The financial models will be key components of strategic investments when it comes to project planning, financial performance, project schedules, and quality control. The Business Analystwill play a key role in monitoring market conditions, researching industry trends, and client spends as inputs into the business line business planning process.

Roles/Responsibilities

Provide financial analysis and support for various projects, including feasibility studies, strategic partnerships, new business ventures, alternative investments, and strategic initiatives.
Provide insightful and data-driven analysis on potential investments and develop investment strategies that meet the needs of their team or clients.
Build and maintain financial models for project finance and alternative investments, including cash flow projections, balance sheet analysis, and capital expenditure forecasting.
Perform financial analysis on a range of investment opportunities and present findings to senior management.
Monitor and track the performance of investments, including analyzing financial statements and assessing financial risk.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure accurate financial reporting and analysis and provide input on financial strategy and decision-making.
Support financial modeling for client projects, including supporting the preparation of reports and recommendations to enable our clients to make informed decisions and adjust strategies, where required.
Maintain and communicate monthly business line financial status analysis.
Collaborate with T&D Business Manager on data modeling and financial summary development.
Facilitate development of business line (and other topic) collateral and presentations with marketing
Support business line annual planning, quarterly meetings and, coordination with regional office business line leadership
Facilitate development project organization (roles and responsibilities, org charts, etc.) for project teams.
Research and communicate market and client trends, risks, and opportunities.
Existing contract coordination with business line regarding new opportunities with existing clients and planning and coordination new contract negotiations with business line and legal
Review and audit team quality performance
Assist and coordinate non-conformances, corrective actions, and lessons learned presentations.
Communicate non-conformances and corrective actions to business line Project Managers
All other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

3-5 years of experience.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in finance, accounting, economics, business or a related field. MBA preferred.
Proven experience in financial analysis, with a focus on project finance and alternative investments. Experience in private equity, infrastructure investment, or investment banking preferred.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with experience building complex financial models.
Knowledge of financial markets, valuations and investment strategies, with the ability to conduct market research and analysis to identify trends and opportunities.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to communicate complex financial information to non-financial stakeholders.
Self-motivated with a proven ability to work independently and as part of a team, with excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.
Strong interpersonal skills with experience working with cross-functional teams, including accounting, legal, finance and engineering teams, to achieve common objectives.
Ability to use various software tools, including models, spreadsheets, and databases, to perform analysis and compellingly communicate findings.
Proficiency in financial modeling software and Microsoft Excel. Working knowledge of the entire suite of Microsoft Office tools, including PowerBI.
Ability to analyze and interpret balance sheets, cashflows, and income statements.
General understanding of accounting/GAAP.
Basic knowledge of economic application software.
Prior internship and/or related consulting experience preferred.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
Strong attention to detail.

Overview:

At TierPoint, we are technologists, trendsetters, explorers, and creative minds who like to push the limits of imagination. We are seeking others who share our passion for technology, possess a never-ending curiosity to learn new things and work with cutting edge technology.


Our Enterprise Operations Support Analysts (EOC Support Analyst) provide real-time solutions to our enterprise clients around the clock. This is the perfect position to start your career and learn the ropes into the world of managed services technology. The opportunities for career advancement are right in front of you when you put your best foot forward.


Successful TierPoint EOC candidates are effective team & client communicators utilizing a myriad of tech resources and tools. This position is a first point of contact for TierPoint clients. You are playing both defense and offense – ensuring future successes for all parties involved. Truth be told, this position requires a major portion of the workday to be spent on client calls. You will openly communicate with fellow team members to investigate client managed service needs. It is a role for driven customer service- focused individuals that thrive in a fast-paced (like…lightning speed!) work environment. Our shifts don’t allow for much down time, but you won’t take work home with you. We have lots of fun too. Our great team and support system will help you learn and build your career. We laugh and joke, catch a sports game on the big TV monitor and we’re a family when it comes down to it.


Our EOC Support Analysts join TierPoint with an established path to learn and grow within a very successful EOC team. Through every step of this career progression, you will be offered extensive training for your current role so you may develop into a seasoned Analyst, Specialist and Engineer.


At TierPoint, we recognize the unique contributions that each team member brings to the table regardless of their role in the company. We all roll up our sleeves, keep our feet on the accelerator, and choose to see the positives and growth potential. Are you up for it?


TierPoint is a national leader in providing Colocation and Managed Hybrid IT & Cloud solutions. We are in the right space at the right time making us a very exciting place to be.
Responsibilities:
Making Customer Service the number 1 priority when it comes to all communications and problem solving mainly via phone then chat and email
Being adaptable in an environment that changes quickly
Handle and communicate client requests, escalations, and issues to the EOC Team
Able to efficiently and accurately carry out multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Qualifications:
High School Diploma or equivalent
Strong and empathetic customer service mindset and attitude
Superior communication skills, both verbal and written
Enjoys team collaboration and forward thinking
Basic understanding of computer and IT functions
Eager to venture out and learn new technologies

Job Title: PPO Front-Office Business Operational Insights Analyst
Job Description:
If you need assistance during the recruiting process due to a disability, please reach out to our Recruiting Accommodations Team through the Accommodation Request form. This form is used only by individuals with disabilities who require assistance or adjustments in applying and interviewing for a job. This form is not for inquiring about a position or the status of an application.

PPO Front-Office Business Operational Insights Analyst

The Business Operational Insights Analyst role for the Partner Payments Operation Front-Office team is a highly meaningful role in supporting the business objectives of PPO globally. You will be responsible for developing, analyzing, and drawing insights from the core operational and performance metrics for lodging, non-lodging and strategic lines of business and partners type across the globe. This will include providing insight and actions across all the relevant areas, supporting tactical and strategic decision-making.

You will actively work with cross-functional team members (Business Intelligence, Central Support Team, Expedia for Business, Invoicing and Cash Operations, etc.) to integrate data and transform it into actionable business insights. Your work will influence major functions of the PPO business and a deep understanding of the core operations and performance drivers of our business models and partner types. You will have regular and frequent interaction with senior leadership across the organization and will need to maintain strong alignment and partnerships with key departments and businesses.

What you'll do:

Drive reporting, analysis and insights of performance and operational metrics for key functions

Provide regular reporting to the internal stakeholders on business results and key drivers for the PPO businesses

Monitor progress towards achieving the operating metrics that result in hitting our performance objectives

Collaborate with Program Managers and Site Leaders to ensure the implementation of initiatives essential to achieving our business goals

Provide business analysis for key initiatives designed to achieve short-term financial goals and long-term business strategies

Develop data-driven insights that achieve higher collections effectiveness and efficacy while keeping partner satisfaction at the highest level

Who you are:

3-5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, Reporting Tools and analytics

3-5+ years of experience in Partner Payment Operations, Accounts Receivable or Collections desired

SQL and Python advanced knowledge

Exposure and experience in large database manipulation

Experience with PowerBI, Tableau, QlikSense, SalesForce and other data platforms

Strong attention to detail and excellent organization skills

Demonstrated track record of creative and structured approach to problem solving

Ability to build effective relationships across a matrix of functional teams

Ability to work both at the “30,000-feet” level for the overall business, as well as the “ground” level to gather insights or drive execution

Passion and tenacity for solving problems through creativity and resourcefulness

Desire and ability to learn quickly

Strong internal partner management skills

Logic and common sense in performing quantitative analyses and sharp sensitivity to implications and impact

Comfortable dealing with uncertainty by creating structure and prioritizing effectively

The total cash range for this position in Springfield is $49,000 to $64,000. Employees in this role have the potential to increase their pay up to $75,000, which is the top of the range, based on ongoing, demonstrated, and sustained performance in the role.

Starting pay for this role will vary based on multiple factors, including location, available budget, and an individual’s knowledge, skills, and experience. Pay ranges may be modified in the future.

Company Description


Ascent is a leading provider of comprehensive solutions for the planning, design, engineering, development and operation of data centres and other mission critical facilities. Headquartered in Saint Louis, MO, Ascent specializes in powerful, efficient and technologically advanced mission critical facilities and offers clients a broad range of delivery models spanning shell & core, build-to-suit, turnkey and outsourced critical systems operations. Founded in 1998, Ascent provides a full spectrum of fast track services that include project programming, design management, facility assessment, development and construction management, commissioning and ongoing maintenance operations. Today, Ascent focuses on providing clients with innovative solutions and services yielding the highest levels of operational autonomy, efficiency and control. Ascent's clients include some of the most demanding mission critical organizations spanning multiple industries, Fortune 500 firms, and service providers.



Job Description


The role of the Customer Success Manager will be responsible for overall client support and service deliverables. The Customer Success Manager will serve as the primary point of contact for all communications and services between client personnel and Ascent’s personnel. This role will ensure compliance with contractual obligations, along with understanding scopes of work for all clients’ equipment types and preventive maintenance, corrective maintenance, emergency maintenance, reporting, workflow process including financial. This person will collaborate with the Client and Site Operations Teams, Finance & Accounting Teams, Development, and Engineering & Construction along with Senior Management in setting departmental goals, direction, and vision.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

Project management services during Statement of Work development, customer implementation/transition, and post implementation client management & support. Create functional project requirements for client signoff. Coordinate and track these requirements with Service Operations, Finance & Accounting, Engineering & Construction, IT Site Services, and Business Development Executives.
Develop full scale project plans and associated communication documents.
Effectively communicate project expectations, timelines, updates, and milestones to customers and senior management in a clear and timely fashion.
Define project & customer success criteria and disseminate these to all involved parties, throughout the project life cycle.
Assess needs for additional resources as they relate to client services and support. Make the appropriate recommendations to senior management as required.
Proactively identify and resolve issues and conflicts within the project delivery teams and departments.
Plan and schedule project timelines, milestones and reporting metrics using appropriate tools.
Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements documentation and presentations.
Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential risk and devise contingency plans.
Actively pursue new business with existing clients.
Work closely with Site Operations and Senior Management to develop best practices and tools for project execution and department management.
Perform all relevant administrative functions of account management, including billings and revenue tracking, purchase order usage tracking, meeting notes internal task tracking, statement of work fulfillment reporting, renewal management, and general account organization/housekeeping.
Plan, coordinate, and develop routine Client engagements/outings to promote a team atmosphere and client inclusion.



Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Business, IT, Engineering, or other Engineering Discipline or equivalent, is preferred.
3-10 years as a Business Analyst, System’s Analyst, Project Manager, Account Manager, or relevant experience.
An understanding of the System Design Life Cycle or Project Management Professional preferred.
Strong computer skills including proficiency in Microsoft office computer applications such as Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and MS Project.
Exceptional project management and organizational skills. Strong analytical and decision-making skills and advanced troubleshooting and problem-solving abilities. Ability to maintain performance level under varying degrees of pressure and uncertainty, and effectively dealing with situations for which few or no guidelines exist.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Present themselves well to customers with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely, applying appropriate grammar; listen attentively before proposing solutions; present ideas in a logical, compelling manner in both small and large group settings; communicate technical information to a non-technical audience; and integrate large volumes of information from multiple sources.
Initiative-taker with a powerful desire for achievement and ambition who can demonstrate the ability to lead a team while being an excellent “team player.”

Additional Information


This position reports to the Director, Client Operations & Success

All interested candidates should apply through the ad or visit www.ascent-corp.com and select the careers tab to apply for the position.

Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

Context

The shift within Higher Education more from one-time purchases of print textbooks to recurring subscriptions of digital products has generated a wealth of data about our products, customers, opportunities, and sales.

We’re looking for a leader who can take this information and leverage the latest data analytics tools, especially Tableau, to provide insight into the performance of business.

Reporting to the Director of Business Intelligence and sitting within the Strategic Sales Operations wing of US Higher Ed Sales Operations, the Sr Business Intelligence Analyst leads the analyses of the sales pipeline, net sales, subscriptions, and market data across multiple formats, models, and channels.

Responsibilities

Forecasting Mastery: Take the helm in owning all aspects of forecasting seasonal revenue, turning data into a strategic asset for our team.
Collaborative Insight: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, finance, and product, to deliver accessible and consumable insights into the success of our higher education products.
Dashboard Stewardship: Support the lifecycle of our Tableau dashboards, ensuring they remain up to date with the latest features and capabilities while streamlining and retiring those that are no longer necessary.
Analytical Evolution : Drive the evolution of our analytics capabilities from self-service to predictive and early alert insights into product, sales, and market trends.
Data Integrity Guardian : Manage functional areas of data management, forecasting, contacts, leads, opportunities, dashboards, and reports, ensuring data integrity across our systems.
Strategic Partner: Assist in turning sales data into actionable insights that inform our go=to-market strategy, emphasizing focus areas, maximizing revenue, and preventing revenue leakage.

Essential Skills:

Holistic Business Understanding: Detailed comprehension of the sales business process and the ability to translate business needs into technical specifications.
Communication Prowess: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex topics and present them thoughtfully to senior leaders.
Tech Savvy: Comfort with navigating the complexity of data across legacy and third-party platforms, ensuring forward momentum while simplifying and standardizing.
Organizational Agility : Strong time-management and organizational skills to balance multiple competing priorities.
Data Expertise: Background with ETL logic, data modeling concepts, and 5+ years of experience in a technical data role.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or computer-related program
5+ years of experience in a technical data role, such as analyst, engineer, architect, or scientist 5
5+ years of experience with multiple versions of SQL
5+ years of experience building and maintaining Tableau dashboards

Preferred Skills

Proficiency with Salesforce Sales Cloud (Marketing & Services Clouds a plus)
Proficiency with cloud databases such as Google BigQuery or Snowflake
Experience with machine learning concepts such as predictive modeling, categorization, and clustering
Background with programming in a language such as R or Python
Experience working in or supporting Sales or Revenue Operations a plus
