Enterprise Risk Management Analyst Sr.

Start something good. Empower your career.

Employee owners have made Cenlar the nation’s leading mortgage loan subservicer. Our unique culture is defined by our core values of respect, trust, integrity and care. A promote-from-within philosophy, and opportunities for continuous professional growth make Cenlar a great place to launch or boost your career. Consider this opportunity to join our team as an Enterprise Risk Management Analyst Sr.

The Enterprise Risk Management Analyst designs, implements, and maintains data and infrastructure solutions that enables highly effective Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) programs. This role also performs risk data analysis and prepares reporting packages to support management and leaders at different levels.

Responsibilities:

Supports the system, data and reporting needs for ERM programs that are designed to proactively and systematically identify, assess, monitor, report and escalate Key Risk and Key Performance issues on a timely basis
Works with internal and external stakeholders, and leads the design, implementation, maintenance, and testing of GRC system solution, and system-based reports, either related to new module development, or reconfigurations of the existing modules
Coordinates with internal stakeholders at different levels, gathers requirements to define, design, and implement risk-based portfolio level reports or reporting packages for key meetings owned / led / participated by the ERM management, using quantitative and qualitative analytics, in Excel, PowerPoint and Word formats
Develops robust validation procedures and ensures high quality and report integrity, by self-validating or certifying reports and obtain proper approval prior to publication or distribution
Proactively performs periodic checking on exceptions found in system, data, and reporting, and work with Line 1, Line 2 and Line 3 functions for timely resolution
Leads the identification of emerging issues and vulnerabilities by performing trending analysis and risk aggregation, including escalating concerns of significant severity to the department head and other senior risk officers
Periodically reviews the department procedures and user manuals to ensure documentations are accurate and new system changes are captured on a timely basis
Supports the client issues reporting and regulatory reporting as needed
Works with the Governance functions to facilitate timely rectification of GRC data, supports remediation resources on the timely remediation of issues/MAPs, and data imports to support new ERM initiatives
Primarily responsible for ongoing maintenance and administration of Cenlar’s GRC system, which supports multiple modules and risk programs
Works collaboratively with business owners for each module in defining and maintaining a robust user access management framework
Maintains GRC architecture documentation and helps manage GRC vendor relationship
Manages team Change Management for GRC and Reporting SharePoint site and process, by vetting changes and ensuring all requirements and approval documentation is obtained
Provides recommendations and guidance on necessary enhancements or changes to the system, or reporting, and assists timely training to improve end-user experience or system functionality
Standardizes, streamlines, and automates the GRC system, and reporting solutions where possible
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, include but not limited to compliance and operational risk. Demonstrate consideration for Cenlar’s reputation as well as our clients, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
Minimum of 5 to 7 years of experience in banking, audit, risk management, compliance, consulting, project management or computer science, with exposure to operational risk, compliance, risk and controls management, or audit experience (preferably within a mortgage or banking environment)
3+ years or solid experience working with financial services / GRC Systems / Risk Management Software products, proven ability to work with complexed data sets
Experienced and comfortable with system configuration and integration, as well as managing system access and implementing security measurements
Must demonstrate sound understanding of Enterprise Risk Management frameworks and internal control principles and concepts
Ability to analyze and credibly assess the effectiveness of risk management and internal controls, as well as the operational and financial impact of findings and control issues
Advanced skills with Microsoft Office Suite, with expert level skillset in Excel (formula writing, CSV support, pivot tables, able to write VBA code)
Attentive to details, dedication to high quality work. Strong project management and/or business analysis experience
Ability to multi-task and work effectively across the organization, with all levels of staff, to ensure that controls are effectively implemented and monitored
Ability to coordinate and set timelines and drive the implementation accordingly
Excellent written, verbal communication, presentation and organizational skills, and work well with others
Excellent problem resolution skills
Processes critical thinking skills to analyze data and produce meaningful reporting, data and/or infrastructure solutions for emerging business problems
Ability to comfortably challenge and defend his/her position and work productively in a fast-paced, multiple stakeholders environment

Total Rewards:

At Cenlar, you’ll receive an outstanding benefits package that includes paid medical, dental, and life insurance, 401(k), and tuition assistance as well as opportunities for training and professional advancement.

Cenlar is a drug-free workplace and an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer M/F/D/V/SO.

Job Title: Product Management Lead Analyst – Centene Operations Management - Express Scripts - Hybrid
Job Description:
The job profile for this position is Product Management Lead Analyst, which is a Band 3 Senior Contributor Career Track Role.

We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.

The Regulated Markets Centene Operations Management team is responsible for ensuring the execution of key operations accountabilities associated with all regulated lines of business including Medicare, Medicaid, and Marketplace (Exchange / Health Care Reform). The team supports Pharmacy Benefit Management (PBM) delegated responsibilities associated with regulatory audit support, issue management, adjustment processing, Prescription Drug Event (PDE)/encounters reporting and regulatory communications.

The Lead Analyst will ensure the effective delivery of all non-regulatory communications activities (audits, issue management, adjustments ad PDE/encounters). The role will also support initiatives to ensure member/client satisfaction, alignment with client contractual support and client retention. When necessary the analyst will also provide functional SME support to client facing discussions.

Key Responsibilities:

Provides advanced professional input to complex assignments/projects.
Works autonomously, only requiring “expert” level technical support from others.
Follows audit support processes to notify to Express Scripts of client audit needs, facilitate Client/Express Scripts preparation and support for audit scope and document completion of all audit deliverables and findings
Facilitates the intake, triage, root cause analysis, mitigation, impact analysis and closure of all client issues associated with regulatory compliance
Process completion of all adjustment requests aligned with client specific request processes
Ensure accurate delivery, response management and correction of client PDE (Medicare) and Encounter (Medicaid) reporting
Promotes the tracking and documentation of all team activities in associated systems
Supports the client Project Management Office (PMO) and Account Teams with function specific communications needs via account team/client inquiry requests, Field Alert development, deliverable reports and presentations
Compiles and evaluates data on the functional performance. Utilizes in-depth professional knowledge and acumen to develop models and procedures and monitor trends.
Exercises judgment in the evaluation, selection, and adaptation of both standard and complex techniques and procedures.
May assist, coordinate or lead portions of mid-size projects. Supports and provides direction to more junior professionals.
Exhibits proven ability to work cross-functionally in development and execution of operational plans aligned to enterprise goals and in support of the needs of our clients.
Exercises considerable creativity, foresight, and judgment in conceiving, planning, and delivering initiatives.

Ideal Candidates will offer:

Bachelor’s Degree with a preferred focus of Health Care Administration or Business
At least one year experience in a health plan or PBM setting. Medicare, Medicaid and Marketplace experience a plus.
Able to balance high priority, long-term projects with short-term, immediate deadlines
Creative thinker and exceptional problem solving skills
Ability to follow processes and document information consistently and timely to meet obligations
Able to translate technical data concepts to business partners for understanding and alignment
Proven ability to function in a heavily matrixed environment.
Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office products (particularly Excel, Word, Power Point, etc.).
Experience leading projects and working with cross functional teams, especially Business and Marketing communications teams

Other Essential Skills:

Excellent process mapping and analysis skills
Open communicator; excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively in dynamic, rapidly changing, team-based environment across multiple functions and in support of diverse regulatory obligations.
Critical thinker and creative problem solver, who exercises good judgment in resolving difficult situations, prioritizes and can balance needs with enterprise objectives
Ability to work in a fast-paced deadline-driven environment, and juggle multiple, sometimes competing, priorities and requirements
Ability to motivate, influence and connect others
Ability to influence direction and action; build and leverage internal relationships
Goal oriented and personally accountable; resourceful and self-directed
Adaptable and flexible; open minded, innovative and creative – seeks ‘out of box’ solutions

This is a hybrid role and will require the ability to work in person.

Job Description


When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.

Single-Use Technologies Division. The successful candidate will demonstrate critical thinking skills, ability to analyze and provide recommendations based on disparate data sources, self-drive and effective communication.

The Bioproduction Data Analyst role will deliver critical insights to inform the strategy and economic quantification of business value propositions. The data analyst will work in close collaboration with product management, marketing, R&D, Biological Collaboration Center and commercial teams to develop hypothesis, refine scope and implement analysis

Using analytics and insights, continuously develop and refine modeling programs to assess economic impact of value propositions
Support product marketing and sales with case studies and facility fit analysis for new and existing products

Understand and articulate the impact to existing and new products with respect to product optimization and the impact of new technologies to the customer

Experience in or a good understanding of bioprocessing upstream and downstream processes preferred
2-5 years of experience as a market, strategy, or economic analyst in life sciences industry
Strong experience using data, qualitative and quantitative inputs to refine business strategies
Self-starter with the ability to take projects from concept through to execution with a high attention for detail and proficiency in managing complexity
Innovative problem solver who is creative, curious, and continuously looking at opportunities for improvement

Excellent written and oral communication skills, including presentation experience to large and diverse audiences
Strong organizational skills with the ability to work on multiple projects at the same time
Proficient in Excel (advanced user), Power BI, (BioSolve experience preferred)

We are looking for an experienced Security Operations Center (SOC) Analyst to join our growing security team at the company.

The SOC Analyst will be responsible for ensuring the security of all company group brands and teams by proactively monitoring, detecting, and responding to security incidents and vulnerabilities.

Key Responsibilities:

Monitor and analyze security events and alerts from various sources, including network and security devices, logs, and applications, to identify potential security incidents
Investigate and respond to security incidents, including malware infections, phishing attacks, and other security breaches, by following standard incident response procedures and escalating to senior team members as needed
Work with cross-functional teams to ensure vulnerabilities and exploits are remediated in a timely manner, including tracking remediation efforts and validating fixes
Develop and maintain standard operating procedures and playbooks for incident response and vulnerability management
Continuously monitor and analyze security trends and threats to identify potential risks and recommend appropriate measures to prevent or mitigate them
Maintain and operate security tools and technologies used in the SOC, including intrusion detection and prevention systems, SIEM, firewalls, and endpoint protection tools
Collaborate with other members of the security team, including the cloud security team, network security team, and application security and engineering team, to provide a cohesive security strategy for Tripadvisor
Stay up to date with the latest security threats and vulnerabilities, and implement best practices for threat detection and incident response

Required Skills and Qualifications:

Minimum of 3 years of experience working in a SOC or similar security operations role
Experience with security tools and technologies, such as SIEM, intrusion detection and prevention systems, firewalls, and endpoint protection tools
Knowledge of network protocols and infrastructure, and experience with network security tools and technologies
Familiarity with cloud security principles and best practices
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, and to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Relevant security certifications, such as CISSP, CISM, or GIAC, are a plus

Ability to work remotely from anywhere in the world

Opportunity to influence product development
We cover English classes (with a native speaker)
Boost professional brand: you can participate in local conferences as a listener or as a speaker

Job Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst - Identity Access Management
Job Description:
At Edward Jones, we help clients achieve their serious, long-term financial goals by understanding their needs and implementing tailored solutions. To ensure a personal client experience, we have located our 15,000+ branch offices where our more than 7 million clients live and work.

In a typical branch office, a financial advisor meets with clients and receives branch office support, so they can focus on building deep relationships with clients. Headquarters associates in St. Louis, Tempe and Mississauga provide support and expertise to help U.S. and Canada branch teams deliver an ideal client experience. We continue to grow to meet the needs of long-term individual investors.
Team Overview:
The Identity & Access Management team is responsible for enabling capabilities to govern the access lifecycle of our Financial Advisors and Home office associates across our application and infrastructure landscape. Our key capabilities include Identity Governance & Administration, Privileged Access Management, Single Sign-On, Federation, Multifactor Authentication, API Security, & Directory Services. We are responsible for supporting and enhancing our existing systems and developing technology solutions that support and enhance the technology division in alignment with the Firm's vision.

What You'll Do...
The Identity and Access Management (IAM) Sr. Business Analyst is responsible for partnering with functional leaders from across the organization to build new identity solutions with an approach that emphasizes speed, value creation, and innovation. As part of this continuous value creation loop, we are looking for an individual that can analyze and translate business requirements and ultimately support our Identity & Access Management team with brining new solutions & experiences to life.

The Sr. Business Analyst will review, analyze and evaluate end-user needs as defined by strategic goals of the product team, along with querying and analyzing data, to create user stories and system specifications.
Assist in the creation of department program governance processes and meeting facilitation (dashboard creation, status tracking, coordination with internal and external department stakeholders)
Support Product Owners and Product Management in feature writing, story writing, and requirements gathering
Create, maintain and review business process models, business decision documents, requirements, use cases, and test cases
Coordinate dependencies and interfaces between different product teams and systems
Balance activities across multiple projects of moderate to high complexity at the same time
Perform data analysis that facilitates the transformation of complex data/information into actionable insights to support highly complex business processes using agile methodology
Execute and present written and verbal business systems impact analysis
Liaison between product team and stakeholders to proactively identify opportunities to create, maintain, enhance, or integrate existing and new solutions
Understanding and communication of cross divisional systems and impacts of change
Generate communication, process, and educational plans to mitigate the disruption of change
Responsible for business case development and presentation of new systems and solutions
Build and maintain working relationships throughout the Firm
Identify and make suggestions for improvements when problems and/or opportunities arise
Assist with PowerPoint presentation creation and polishing for a wide range of audiences
Support user acceptance testing through test case generation, template creation, and result tracking
What Experience You'll Need...
Degree Preferred
Bachelor's Degree in Management Information Systems, or similar field
Technical Skills
Knowledge of the SDLC process for software and solution development
Familiarity with SAFe / Agile frameworks and knowledge of product management roles and responsibilities (Product Owner, Scrum Master, RTE, Product Manager etc.)
Basic familiarity with technology and / or IAM solutions & capabilities (e.g. Authentication, Identity Governance and Administration, Single Sign On)
Strong organizational skills to effectively prioritize tasks and manage personal workload

**Candidates that live within in a commutable distance from our Tempe, AZ and St. Louis, MO home office locations are expected to work in the office three days per week, with preference for Tuesday through Thursday"**

Provide industry-focused vision and direction to the Information Technology team. This position and the Business Acceleration team act as a primary liaison between IT and business.
Maintains third party relationships and evaluates vendor solutions for integration into operations.

Health Capital Consultants (HCC), an established, nationally recognized healthcare financial and economic consulting firm based in suburban St. Louis, MO, has an immediate full-time career position available for a Business Valuation - Senior Financial Analyst professional. HCC’s services include: valuation of healthcare enterprises, assets and services in all healthcare sectors; healthcare provider related intermediary services, including, integration, affiliation, acquisition and divestiture, and ACO development; Certificate of Need (CON) and regulatory consulting; financial analysis, including the development of forecasts, budgets and income distribution plans; and, litigation support and expert witness services.

The successful candidate for this full time, career position will assist in all aspects of analysis of financial and economic data, and will play an integral role in the development of conclusions and opinions, as well as the writing of comprehensive reports related to a diverse range of valuation projects.

Example of Essential Duties Include:

Project Management – ability to oversee all aspects and management of the engagement process for multiple projects at once

Communication – provide clients and HCC colleagues with real-time, concise yet comprehensive communication

Valuation Modeling – performing various financial analyses and excel-based modeling, as well as preparing deliverables

Writing – drafting narrative reports in support of valuation opinions and calculations

Promotion – contribute to the promotion of HCC through writing (HCC’s monthly e-journal and externally published articles) and teaching/speaking (on healthcare or valuation topics on local and national platforms)

Minimum qualifications include a bachelor's degree, preferably in finance or economics, and 5 years’ experience in a business or healthcare valuation role, with specific knowledge of compensation/asset valuation (client interfacing experience required). Candidate must have worked on a variety of valuation engagements, as well as have been published or have spoken on industry topics. Graduate degree training is preferable. Must currently hold valuation accreditation(s) such as ASA, CFA, CVA, CPA/ABV. Must be highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and related programs. Must be legally authorized to work in the U.S.

Attractive salary and benefits package.

Operations Research Analyst

Hybrid

St. Louis, MO, US

Job description

Infoscitex, a DCS Company, is seeking an Operations Research Analyst to support extensive high visibility Modeling, Simulation, and Analysis (MS&A) efforts. Are you interested in working in a high-tech company on cutting edge technology to help solve national security problems? Do you want to be challenged every day supporting world class research and development? If so, Infoscitex may be the place for you! A DCS company, Infoscitex is an employee owned organization known for creating agile technology solutions across the U.S. Defense, Aerospace, Human Factors, and Security markets.

As a member of our team, you will support defense technologies along with research and development in St. Louis, MO, having opportunities to work in a dynamic environment, with state of the art simulation technologies, simulation integration experts, and experienced military Subject Matter Experts (SME). Our work focuses on conducting capability assessments for emerging military technologies and ensuring related tools and methodologies are suitable to inform Department of Defense (DoD) decision makers.

Essential Job Functions:

As a Operations Research Analyst, you could expect to:

Construct military models and entities of varying complexity in the Advanced Framework for Simulation, Integration, and Modeling (AFSIM).

Provide dynamic scripting techniques to produce modeled entity actions/interactions in AFSIM.

Create and enhance operationally relevant scenarios that accurately represent actions, reactions, and interactions between entities in the AFSIM simulation.

Contribute to the development and execution of MS&A study plans to be conducted using AFSIM.

Collaorate with subject matter experts, such as pilots and technologists, to identify requirements for system implementation in AFSIM.

Coordinate with team members to contribute to execution of analysis of studies, analyze AFSIM results, and prepare and present study findings.

Collaborate with agile AFSIM software development teams to build and enhance MS&A solutions.

Collaborate with study leads and customer stakeholders to identify study requirements and develop relevant technical approaches.

Required Skills:

Due to the sensitivity of customer related requirements, U.S. Citizenship is required.

At least a BS degree in engineering, science, mathematics, or a related technical discipline and at least two years of related experience.

Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government background investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information: eligible to attain a Secret level U.S. DoD security clearance.

Excellent written and verbal English communications skills.

Ability to apply the scientific method to diverse MS&A efforts.

Scripting and/or programming experience in one or more of the following languages/tools: C++, Python, R, JMP, STK.

Ability to work well in team environments.

Ability to travel approximately 10% of the time, as required.

Desired Skills:

Hands-on experience creating AFSIM scenarios and models for engagement and/or mission level studies.

MS in engineering, science, mathematics, or related technical discipline.

Active security clearance, Secret or higher.

Familiarity with modern military systems, both foreign and domestic.

The Sales Business Intelligence Analyst works with sales and marketing leadership team to translate business questions and requirements into insights, tools and reporting to assist in marketing and sales strategies. This position will focus on gathering primarily and secondary research, market analysis and competitive intelligence into succinct actionable perspectives and points of view. Work with Sales, Marketing and other business leaders to understand the business fundamentals in order to provide research and analytical tools that enable the discovery of key insights and business drivers

Design executive level self-service-oriented reporting to support sales strategies and decision making; help provide data in support of customer data needs and presentations.
Monitor and provide timely analysis of competitive movements in the market to enable key members of the organization to make sound decisions
Collaborate with finance and IT to provide consistent data across all areas of the company
Provide decision support via reports, dashboards, ad hoc analysis, and analytics
Document critical business processes and data definition for core reports and dashboards

Experience with relational and non-relational databases
Experience in translating numbers, secondary research and insights into a written story

Quantitative & synthesis skills
Strategic thinker

Self-driven and inquisitive.

Job Summary

The Data Product Manager is responsible for the development and the overall success of data products for Stifel. The data product manager owns the data product strategy behind a product or data product, specifies its functional requirements, and collaborates with data teams and software engineering teams to plan the data product delivery process. The Product Manager is responsible for identifying the client's needs, understanding the larger business objectives, and analyzing this information to create a product roadmap that will deliver the highest value and outcomes. The Product Manager articulates what success looks like for a product and encourages cross-functional teams to turn the vision into reality. This role will drive product adoption, engagement, and customer satisfaction by prioritizing, managing, and creating new features. This position is responsible for the continuous cycle of the product from concept to promotion while continuously listening and exploring.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Work with agile and non-agile development, engineering, design, data, marketing, business stakeholders, vendors, and support teams to create and deliver data products.
Define and communicate the high-level mission, vision, and roadmap to cross-functional teams.
Prioritize new data products based on customer needs in alignment with the Firm's strategy, goals, and technical capabilities.
Perform user research and data analytics to form hypotheses and translate product requirements.
Lead cross-functional teams to collaborate and communicate across the Firm.
Define Leading Indicators, KPIs, and metrics to measure the success of the data products.
Apply agile methods and processes to promote a disciplined framework that encourages frequent inspection and adaptation of ongoing work.
Foster communication and collaboration with Senior Business Leaders and their teams to create a clear and transparent product roadmap that aligns with the Firm's goals and top priorities.
Some travel by car and/or air with local, regional, and/or national travel, up to 20%.

Qualifications

Ability to manage and develop products with demonstrable and measurable results.
Proven experience making tough, non-biased decisions backed by user research, data analytics, A/B experimentation, user testing, competitors and marketing analysis, and metrics.
Ability to communicate with all levels and types of people, in all types of communication methods, ensuring they understand decisions and directions.
Solid understanding of technical problems, how to break down the work involved in solving them, and the impact of those decisions on engineering and the organization.
Experience with Kanban, the Scaled Agile Framework, Agile, or Scrum processes.
Ability to gather and listen to information to make constructive, unbiased decisions considering overarching Firm strategy, goals, policies, and procedures.
Proven understanding of databases and ability to read and write basic SQL.
Strong documentation skills, specifically writing requirements, user acceptance testing, and other strategic documentation to communicate vision and strategy.
Ability to work hands-on with data, use SQL to analyze data and understand data schemas and governance.
Good knowledge and understanding of data platforms and data quality SLAs and tracking.

Education & Experience

Bachelor's Degree in a related field; or equivalent experience required
7+ years of experience in finance, technology, analysis, leadership, or product ownership or management.
2+ years of experience working with cloud-based data warehouses such as Snowflake and Redshift.
2+ years of experience with AWS and/or Azure.
2+ years of experience working directly as a Data analyst or equivalent role.
3+ years of experience as a product manager who has helped stand-up data platforms bring together data from various sources for downstream use in business analysis.

Systems & Technology

Experience working with cloud-based data warehouses such as Snowflake and Redshift.
Experience with AWS and/or Azure.

About Stifel

Stifel is a more than 130 years old and still thinking like a start-up. We are a global wealth management and investment banking firm serious about innovation and fresh ideas. Built on a simple premise of safeguarding our clients’ money as if it were our own, coined by our namesake, Herman Stifel, our success is intimately tied to our commitment to helping families, companies, and municipalities find their own success.

While our headquarters is in St. Louis, we have offices in New York, San Francisco, Baltimore, London, Frankfurt, Toronto, and more than 400 other locations. Stifel is home to approximately 9,000 individuals who are currently building their careers as financial advisors, research analysts, project managers, marketing specialists, developers, bankers, operations associates, among hundreds more. Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.

At Stifel we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental and vision care, 401k, wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off.

Stifel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Title: Data Governance Analyst/Business Analyst - Corporate IT (Kansas City)
Job Description:
Description

Job Summary:

We are seeking a Data Governance Analyst to join our team. As a Data Governance Analyst, you will play a critical role in developing and implementing the data governance framework to ensure the quality, accuracy, and completeness of our organization's data. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including data stewards, business analysts, and IT teams, to establish and maintain data policies, standards, and guidelines to ensure compliance and adherence to industry best practices.

Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain data governance policies, procedures, and standards for the organization and ensure they align with the regulations and other data policies developed.
Develop and implement audit procedures to monitor compliance and support the policies and procedures developed.
Develop, implement, and manage the data quality framework to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
Participate in workshops, POC’s, selection and implementation of a Policy engine, Data quality tools etc.
Work collaboratively with business and IT partners and data owners across business units to implement data governance practices that enable data discovery, security, compliance, and trust.
Develop and maintain data cataloging and inventory management practices.
Create and maintain data dictionaries and business glossaries.
Establish data lineage and metadata management processes to support the organization's data management needs.
Work with the key stakeholders in defining, developing, and implementing a Role-Based Access Control system in line with the organization's requirements.
Assist with data classification activities and help develop data retention policies and procedures.
Lead education and training related to data management policies and procedures to business partners, data stewards and end users. Support centralized and decentralized data domain and product owners in the understanding of their data governance responsibilities.
Work with other information and operational teams to ensure that our data assets are healthy, trusted, accessible and secure, and are used in a meaningful, consistent, and compliant manner.
Monitor, assess and report on data quality issues and risks to management and stakeholders.
Work with IT teams to ensure data security and privacy requirements are met.
Enlist business unit support and ensure data domain ownership of data products.
Create methods for monitoring, addressing, and reporting any data incidents.
Help define and execute data governance operational processes (e.g., data quality measurement) in accordance with policies and standards, clearly articulating roles and responsibilities.

Define and strive to achieve Data Governance Objectives and Key Results (OKRs).

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent years of experience
5 years' experience as a Data Steward, Data Quality Analyst and/or Business Analyst
Familiarity with the DAMA Data Management Body of Knowledge (DMBOK)
Knowledge of data governance frameworks, policies, and procedures
CDMP certification a plus
Experience with data analysis, data governance, data quality, business data modeling and/or reporting
Experience in metadata management, data cataloging, data lineage, data modeling and data management tools such as ER/Studio, Alation
In-depth knowledge and experience with Financial Services terminology, concepts, business processes and systems within a core data domain a plus
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
SQL experience preferred

Job Title: Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Business Analyst
Job Description:
We Are:

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

You Are:

An analytics consultant at heart, with broad knowledge of the digital analytics space and a deep understanding Adobe’s offerings and solutions. Bringing your experience implementing Adobe Customer Journey Analytics (CJA) and/or Adobe Analytics end-to-end solutions for clients, you know what it takes to transform cross-channel datasets into meaningful metrics and visualizations. Working closely with business stakeholders, you’re the go-to person for crafting insightful reports and dashboards that address critical business questions. On top of your technical expertise, you excel at leading project teams in fast paced environments and collaborating effectively with clients and team members at all levels.

The Work:

Lead teams to design, build, and maintain large-scale analytics solutions.

Strategize and implement Adobe Analytics and Customer Journey Analytics solutions together with client Business and Marketing teams, Architects, and Developers.

Work with client stakeholders to determine reporting requirements and KPIs for cross-organizational use cases.

Design and build cross-channel reports in Customer Journey Analytics to derive meaningful and actionable insights from large datasets.

Ensure that Data Governance policies and best practices are implemented and enforced across all systems.

Build and maintain Data Views and Connections in CJA, work closely with AEP Data Engineers to ingest additional data sources.

Provide and evangelize best-in-class documentation and enablement.

Articulate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and in writing.

Exemplify excellent consulting skills, diplomacy, effective messaging, and team mentorship abilities.

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.




What you Need:

A minimum of 3 years of experience implementing an Adobe Experience Cloud analytics product (Adobe Analytics or Customer Journey Analytics) along with Adobe Tags

A minimum of 1 year of hands-on experience working with Adobe Customer Journey Analytics.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (12 years) work experience (If an, Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience).

Bonus Points If:

Certified in at least 1 Adobe Experience Could product (Customer Journey Analytics, Analytics, Real-Time CDP, Journey Optimizer).

You are proficient in SQL, Python, or an equivalent coding language for data processing and analysis.

You have experience implementing Adobe Real-Time CDP or Adobe Target.

Job Title: Business Analysis Manager


Job Summary:

The Business Analysis Manager is responsible for leading a team of IT business analysts to support the planning, development, and implementation of technology solutions within the government sector. This position plays a critical role in understanding business needs, assessing existing systems, and collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that IT projects align with government objectives and regulatory requirements.


Key Responsibilities:

Team Leadership:
Manage and lead a team of IT business analysts, providing guidance, mentorship, and performance management.
Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture that encourages professional development and knowledge sharing.
Business Analysis:
Identify, document, and analyze business processes, requirements, and objectives.
Develop and maintain a clear understanding of government policies, regulations, and procedures related to technology projects.
Collaborate with business units to define project scope and objectives.
Requirements Elicitation:
Engage with stakeholders to gather, validate, and prioritize requirements for IT projects.
Create detailed requirements documentation, including functional and technical specifications user stories and functional workflows
Solution Design and Planning:
Translate business requirements into technology solutions and systems.
Work with architects and technical teams to design efficient and cost-effective solutions.
Develop project plans, timelines, and resource allocation to ensure successful project implementation.
Quality Assurance:
Conduct thorough testing and validation of IT solutions to ensure they meet established requirements and government standards.
Implement quality control measures to identify and rectify defects in the systems.
Stakeholder Collaboration:
Facilitate communication and collaboration between IT teams, government departments, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment with government goals and objectives.
Compliance and Security:
Ensure that all IT solutions meet government security and compliance requirements.
Stay current with evolving regulations and implement necessary changes to maintain compliance.
Documentation and Reporting:
Maintain comprehensive records of project documentation, status reports, and project outcomes.
Prepare and present reports to senior management and government officials as required.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
At least 5 years of experience in IT business analysis, with 2 years in a managerial role.
Strong understanding of government operations, policies, and regulations.
Proven experience in leading and managing IT project teams.
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in business analysis tools and methodologies.
Knowledge of project management principles and methodologies (e.g., PMI, Agile, Scrum).
Familiarity with government-specific software and systems is a plus.
Professional certifications, such as CBAP (Certified Business Analysis Professional), PMP (Project Management Professional), or similar, are advantageous.

You could be the one who changes everything for our 28 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.


*Applicants for this job have the flexibility to work remote from home anywhere in the Continental United States*

Position Purpose: The Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) team is responsible for all aspects of ERM and Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) coordination and reporting for Centene Corporate and all subsidiaries. The ERM Analyst position is responsible for identifying, assessing, monitoring, and reporting complex risks, applying knowledge of risk management techniques and is also responsible for supporting ESG and sustainability initiatives. This position partners with multiple business units and/or functional areas to assist with gathering, analyzing, and documenting ERM and ESG data.

Support strategies to improve the company’s ESG ratings and propose actionable plans with appropriate measures to track results and integrate them into company business processes.
Provide input and support Risk Program implementations, management, and oversight including ERM risk analysis, risk assessments, risk education, monitoring, remediation, and reporting.
Analyze ERM data to identify trends and material enterprise-wide risk issues. Identify key risks and mitigating factors and conduct statistical analyses to quantify and assess risk.
Research, benchmark, and evaluate ESG initiatives, guidance, regulations, and standards and identify potential emerging sustainability issues.
Work with multiple business units to gather risk and sustainability-related data from internal and external resources.
Maintain a repository of ERM and sustainability performance metrics and generate reports illustrating data, text, and graphics.
Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Finance/Accounting, Health Administration, Business Administration, Statistics, or related analytical field. 3+ years of related experience with a focus on risk management, data analysis, data modeling, relational databases, and project management. Experience on large projects involving risk, business, or financial analysis with a large company preferred. Previous responsibility for cross-functional business analysis preferred.

License/Certification:
Preferred certifications include:

Certified Risk and Compliance Management Professional (CRCMP)
Certified Risk Management Professional (CRMP)
Governance, Risk and Compliance Professional (GRCP)
Certified Public Accountant (CPA)
Certified Internal Auditor (CIA)
Six Sigma


Our Comprehensive Benefits Package: Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.


Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

PayIt is a fast-growing GovTech company on a mission to modernize how residents interact and transact with government, improving the customer experience and helping our client agencies more efficiently and effectively achieve their missions. Our easy-to-implement platform consolidates government services and payments into one connected experience and enables our clients to drive resident trust, collect revenue quickly, and redeploy their staff to more important challenges. This innovative approach to government service delivery has garnered significant recognition in both the public and private sectors, including our inclusion in the GovTech 100 every year since 2017. PayIt solutions cover services including hunting and fishing licensing, DMV, courts, property tax, utilities, tolling, and more.

Our culture welcomes people who exhibit what we call "PayIt DNA": High integrity, drive, grit, high aptitude, and team orientation. We are collaborative and passionate about the work we do to improve the lives of our government clients and the end users they serve. We have ambitious scaling goals, and we look for team members who are ready to roll up their sleeves, solve problems, and find new opportunities to win with our clients. And we have a lot of fun together.

About this role:

As a Technical Operations Analyst, you will work as a member of the Technical Operations Team. This position will be responsible for both remote and on-site setup, coordination and support of cloud-based POS installations. Hardware primarily includes Android based tablet devices, label printers, scanners and credit card processing devices and other POS peripherals. Occasional travel within the US and Canada may be required.

What You'll Be Doing:
Project Management - Act as primary point of contact for internal teams and external customers to support the setup, configuration, installation and support for POS systems
Systems Administration - Perform installation, hardware and software troubleshooting as needed during deployment. Perform functional testing to ensure flawless installation of hardware, software, and peripherals
Contribute to development and maintenance of documentation to support troubleshooting and process enhancements
Vendor management – manage multiple vendors as well as coordinate on-site and remote resources to resolve issues that arise. Work with vendors to obtain estimates/quotes and to understand lead times for required quantities of hardware.
Clear and direct communication, coordination, and management of all resources during the project.
Continuous Improvement - Maintain technical knowledge related to brand-specific hardware, software, and product lines. Create process documentation and share with stakeholders and look at opportunities to improve installations and continuous maintenance.
Tracking and regular reporting of hardware inventory and status.
Evaluation of new hardware and software solutions against requirements.
What You'll Need to Have:
Technical skills required:
Understanding of Point-of-Sale systems with the ability to interface with those product and engineering teams
Understanding of Mobile devices (Android) and mobile device management. (SOTI is a plus!)
Knowledge of how DHCP and IP based networks are configured
Familiarity with remote administration and support
Technical degree or relevant professional experience in the IT industry
2+ years experience in similar role (POS installations, POS Systems, IT Help Desk)
Strong organizational, interpersonal, communication and customer service skills with both technical and functional end user
Team player willing to pitch in, as needed.
Customer-service focus is a must as this position will be a point of contact for both internal and external stakeholders.

Annual Salary Range:

$50,000—$60,000 USD

Why Work For Us:

Our mission matters. Your work will make life better for our government agency clients and the millions of residents they serve.
You'll do some of the best work of your career here. We tackle complex challenges that are interesting to solve, and you'll grow a ton working at PayIt
People are our most important resource. Everyone has a voice. Collaboration is our default setting. And we have fun together.
We #payitforward with our corporate volunteer program, serving the communities where we work and live.
Competitive salaries, excellent benefits, flexible working arrangements, and all the resources you will need to do your best work.

What We Care About:

We hire high aptitude, high integrity people who are great communicators and want to be part of a growing team.

Commitment to Equal Opportunity

PayIt is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law.

PayIt is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an email to the People Operations Team and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

NOTE: U.S. Citizens and all those authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to provide sponsorship in the United States at this time. Job Title: Capital Markets Operations Trading Analyst I
Job Description:
UMB Institutional Banking encompasses the following areas: Corporate Trust, Specialty Trust & Agency Solutions, Fund Services, Institutional Custody, Capital Markets, Investor Solutions, Public Finance and Healthcare Services. It combines institutionally focused capabilities into one cohesive unit, serving the entire institutional marketplace from smaller correspondent banks and municipalities to the largest broker-dealers and fund companies in the United States.

This team supports the business needs and processing for Capital Markets activities, including Trading and Underwriting, acting as a liaison between sales team, clients and systems users.
As an Operations Trading Analyst I, you will support and partner with Capital Markets business unit stakeholders and staff. You will work with all related to trading, clearance and settlement, for bank dealer activities. Additional duties would include special projects related to business workflow, reporting requirements and some data analysis.
How you’ll spend your time:
You will support Bank Dealer Operations, Trading, Underwriting, Settlement, Safekeeping Custody, Funding, and Portfolio Accounting.
You will provide multiple lines of support and coverage while maintaining bank dealer activities.
You will validate production implementation and assist with end-user training and regulatory compliance.

We’re excited to talk with you if:
You have two (2) years of Securities Trading and Settlements experience or a combination of education and related work experience.
You have one (1) year of business systems analysis experience
You have at least three (3) years of operational support experience
***This position will be onsite for qualified candidates in the Kansas City metro area.***

Position:
Sr. In Market Analytics Business Consultant - Remote
Position Summary:
Responsible for analyzing data to identify opportunities, improve patient outcomes, and translate those improved outcomes into business results. Utilizes skills and understanding of healthcare data, analytic techniques, and population health to create unique, scalable solutions to meet client demands. Uses data from multiple sources (i.e. medical claims, labs, pharmacy, EHR, etc.) to quantify baseline performance, identify opportunities, and the root causes. Collaborates with cross-functional teams in the development and execution of all deliverables. Serves as the first point of contact for data needs.
Job Description:
Primary Responsibilities
Fosters client satisfaction through the development of standard and ad-hoc deliverables and as necessary ensuring resolution to all issues surrounding products and services.
Establishes strong, long-lasting, consultative relationships with clients and looks for ways to extend and expand the client relationship. Guides client expectations and escalations.
Partners with in-market operations leadership and Medical Director to develop the operational strategy and tactics.
Regularly connects with in-market teams to prioritize focuses based on evolving client needs and goals.
Serves as a subject matter expert for the team, advising clients on how to implement workflows that utilize Lumeris insights in clinical workflows, and speaks to the differentiating factors used in Lumeris models.
Provides technical direction and interprets insights for the market account team while collaborating with client partners to guide relationships and impact value.
Collaborates with the client and our operations team to achieve mutually defined goals.
Maintains a strong customer focus and is committed to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers. Obtains and utilizes customer information for improvements in products and services.
Uses a variety of methods, tools, and resources to solve complex problems with effective solutions. Communicates findings, next steps, recommendations, and/or solutions.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in related field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Epidemiology, Public Health, etc.) or equivalent
5+ years of relevant experience in healthcare data analytics or the knowledge, skills, and abilities to succeed in the role
Proven ability to utilize analytics tools including SQL, SAS, SPSS, and/or open source including Python and R, or similar
Capable of writing complex SQL queries and programming within a Microsoft Technology environment
Solid ability to query and extract data from a complex data warehouse using SQL and/or ETL tools
Effective critical thinking and data management skills
Demonstrated ability to work with large data and self-direct in analysis to reach recommendations and conclusions
Thorough knowledge of the healthcare domain and healthcare data
Ability to learn new technologies, and contribute to areas such as infrastructure, administration, and project management
Strong understanding of data model approaches to be able to discuss the pros/cons of each with our clients and data architects and create business requirements
Strong collaboration, interpersonal, and project management skills
Ability to communicate clearly with internal and external customers and a strong service orientation with willingness to go the extra mile to meet client needs
Familiarity with HEDIS & CMS care quality measures and implementing these measures
Solid learning agility and ability to think creatively when looking for solutions
Preferred:
Experience in healthcare or population health sector

While performing the duties of this job, the employee works in normal office working conditions.

Summary

The Project Manager (PM) oversees various projects throughout the department and firm. The PM will be responsible for managing projects, the resources (internal and external) assigned to that work, the timelines established in which that work needs to be completed, and the costs (if applicable) to the work.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Manage projects and lead cross-division functional teams that affect and ensure project goals.
Provide guidance and oversight to business analyst resources assigned to projects.
Oversee planning, development, requirements gathering, specifications, test plans, test execution, issue triage, risk management, and communication to the business units.
Ensure projects are managed to delivery schedules, budget schedules and support business stakeholder expectations.
Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with business users and
business stakeholders.
Communicate to senior management and business stakeholders regarding project status, risks, issues and recommended solutions.
Responsible for making decisions with respect to projects and other work-related items.
Evaluate the outcomes of the project as established during the planning phase.
Some limited travel by car and/or air in conjunction with local, regional and/or national travel.

Qualifications

Strong analytical, organizational and project management skills.
Able to manage one’s own time and priorities to ensure the meeting of deadlines with strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Knowledge of all phases of software development including requirements analysis, design, testing (integration, user, and performance), implementation and support.
Excellent conceptualization, presentation and communication skills to effectively execute change.

Education & Experience

1+ years’ direct work experience in project management and business analysis capacity including all aspects of process development and execution required
Experience in producing analysis documents and testing development plans.

ABOUT STIFEL

Stifel is a more than 130 years old and still thinking like a start-up. We are a global wealth management and investment banking firm serious about innovation and fresh ideas. Built on a simple premise of safeguarding our clients’ money as if it were our own, coined by our namesake, Herman Stifel, our success is intimately tied to our commitment to helping families, companies, and municipalities find their own success.

While our headquarters is in St. Louis, we have offices in New York, San Francisco, Baltimore, London, Frankfurt, Toronto, and more than 400 other locations. Stifel is home to approximately 9,000 individuals who are currently building their careers as financial advisors, research analysts, project managers, marketing specialists, developers, bankers, operations associates, among hundreds more. Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.

At Stifel we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental and vision care, 401k, wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off.

Stifel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Position Overview


Serves as the senior analyst for the Derivative Operations. This entails independently managing the daily processing tasks including validation of new trades, settlement of collateral, and settlement of derivative payments and contributing to change management. The senior analyst is expected to propose solutions and work with senior leadership of the group to drive change including the management of their own projects.


Responsibilities

Processes the routine day to day duties associated with the group’s task list
Daily collateral management including trade valuation, interaction with external trade counterparties, and settlement of activities
Trade capture of all derivative activity
Derivative Reporting
Confirmation Management
Reconciliations with dealers and accounting system
Interest payment processing on all external and internal positions
Internal reporting on Derivative Valuation
Weekly and Monthly internal collateral reporting
Regulatory Reporting (incl. Dodd-Frank) Compliance Management
ISDA and FCM legal document management
Maintaining regular and predictable attendance
Providing ideas and feedback to improve processes and achieve straight through processing

Requirements


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Required:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, Accounting, Math, Science, or equivalent working experience AND
5+ years of derivative related work experience
OR

Masters degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science, Accounting, Math, or Science
3+ years of derivative related work experience
Preferred:

Reinsurance or insurance industry knowledge OR
Banking or Brokerage industry knowledge

SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Required:

Clear interest in deepening knowledge of derivative instruments
Demonstrated ability to deal with complex issues and solve problems both within teams and independently
Good communication skills (both written and verbal)
Ability to be flexible when needed, take initiative, and demonstrate accountability
Ability to set goals, multitask and prioritize workload
Ability to work well within a team environment and participate in department projects
Ability to balance detail with departmental goals/ objectives.
Ability to quickly adapt to new methods, work under tight deadlines and stressful conditions
Ability to work independently
Basic knowledge of derivative processing
Basic knowledge of ISDA documentation
Word and Excel abilities
Beneficial:

Understanding of Relational Databases
Base Knowledge of Derivative Pricing (discounted cashflows)
System Knowledge of Derivative Trade Capture System
Programming skills in SQL and/or Python or equivalent language


Company Overview


Reinsurance Group of America, Incorporated (NYSE: RGA) is one of the largest global providers of life reinsurance, with offices around the world. RGA delivers expert solutions in individual life reinsurance, individual living benefits reinsurance, group reinsurance, financial solutions, facultative underwriting, and product development. Our mission is to enhance our clients’ prosperity by supporting their financial and risk management capabilities.

The general pay range for this position is $85k - $120k base per year. Base pay varies depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and market location. In addition, RGA provides an annual bonus plan that includes all roles and some positions are eligible for participation in our long-term equity incentive plan. RGA also maintains a full range of health, retirement and other employee benefits.

Job Title: GPS Operations Transformation - Healthcare Quality Analyst

Are you looking to make an immediate impact where you can help our clients solve their business challenges? Experience conducting reviews of medical exam documentation in accordance with established medical and legal requirements

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Business Analyst (BA) is the primary liaison between project & business stakeholders of the eCommerce business unit at Helzberg. The successful candidate will be responsible for gathering, documenting, and confirming project requirements in support of business cases, and proposed projects, to facilitate ongoing enhancements and technical support for eCommerce. Additionally, the candidate will assist with project planning, testing, and execution through all phases of the SDLC. Partners closely and manages relationships with business stakeholders throughout Helzberg as well as, internal and external IT and Marketing teams.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Traditional BA projects as assigned: Assist with project intake by helping to define scope, success criteria, and key objectives. Meet with business and technology stakeholders to determine and document business requirements. Regularly collaborate with internal and external development team members to refine requirements into actionable software solutions for eCommerce.
Drive design sessions with internal and external UI/UX stakeholders in prototyping requested features and integrations for the eCommerce site.
Translate project requirements into customer flows, journey maps, and wireframes that will be used to obtain project buy-in from business stakeholders.
Testing: Work with QA team to build test plans and test automation. Perform user acceptance testing and assist with QA testing.
Provide guidance and/or instruction to junior staff members.
Foster Helzberg core values through collaboration, active participation, and task ownership.
Lead smaller site enhancement efforts as assigned.
Inspire and bring new ideas to the team through staying current with eCommerce trends.
Adopt a support mindset for troubleshooting and assisting with production site issue resolution.
QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Information Technology, or Marketing.
Seven plus years’ experience in business analyst type roles preferably in retail or ecommerce.
An equivalent combination of required education and experience would be accepted.
Strong Salesforce Commerce Cloud platform knowledge preferred.
Knowledge and experience with Office365 and other collaboration tools strongly preferred.
SQL proficiency desired to perform data analysis for day-to-day product support and enhancements.
Understanding of eCommerce architecture, solutions, and key technologies such as HTML, Custom CSS themes, CMS.
Experience with Atlassian tools such as Jira and Confluence strongly preferred.
Disciplined and data driven problem solving.
Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language.
Hybrid schedule with predictable onsite attendance required three or more days per week to perform essential functions involving interactive behaviors with co-workers and managers.

Job Description:
Role Overview
This exciting new position supports sales cycle activities for multiple sales teams responsible for solutions leveraged by various markets. The initial target markets for this role are asset management and retirement, specifically for traditional and alternatives fund administration and transfer agency recordkeeping, and retirement plan recordkeeping for plan sponsors and participants. Support for new business and client retention activities are in scope. Specific responsibilities can include project management of RFI/RFPs; proposal content development; sales tool administration; presentation and meeting coordination.
We support a flexible, hybrid work schedule with some in-office work at either our Kansas City, MO or Quincy, MA office locations.
What you will get to do:
Develop and maintain an understanding of SS&C enterprise solutions, with the ability to select target solutions to gain a deeper knowledge to apply to your projects.
Work closely with sales, relationship management, marketing, subject matter experts and operations staff in promoting our products and services, assisting with activities such as campaign coordination and lead management.
Manage sales support activity including the request for proposal (RFP) process, follow-up items and coordination of client and prospect site visits.
Develop sales proposals that are well-written, accurate, and reflect specific customer objectives to ensure focus on strategic themes as well as compliance with RFP requirements.
Maintain RFP response content and manage RFP projects in Loopio, our RFP response application
Coordinate and develop presentations that demonstrate how the proposed solution meets the client's needs.
Collaborate with team members and other sales support groups to identify process improvements to benefit sales team efficiencies and improve the quality of client-facing materials.
Characteristics of Successful Candidates
Bachelor’s degree and 3 years of work-related experience or 5 years equivalent work-related experience.
Financial services industry knowledge is required, preferably in one or more of the following areas: retirement sponsor / recordkeeping and business outsourcing, mutual fund transfer agency operations, business process management (BPM) applications, or related field(s).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Outstanding organization and prioritization skills
Enthusiastic, energetic self-starter able to manage complex projects independently, while collaborating with team members for content and process improvements.
Superior attention to detail
Expertise with Microsoft Office applications – specifically Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
Ability to become comfortable leading a project with large groups and senior leadership teams

Job Posting
American National is seeking a Business Analyst to support our P&C Underwriting Division. The Business Analyst position is right for you if you have previous Business Analyst experience and are ready to step into large-scale projects. In this role, you will work independently while also enjoying the support of a highly collaborative, cross-functional team! Please note this is an in-office position in Albany, NY, or Springfield, MO.


What Will You Do?

Elicits, identifies, and documents written business requirements and user acceptance testing criteria for department service requests and projects and collaborates with other business area BAs to assist in doing the same for product or large strategic initiatives.
Validates requirements match the intention of the stakeholder’s needs, assesses that requirements demonstrate value, and communicates the advantages/disadvantages of alternate solutions when applicable.
Utilize excellent written and verbal skills to communicate recommended solutions, weighing risks, benefits, and potential value.
Investigates and uses data analytics to determine how solutions or processes are performing after deployment and recommends improvements to support change management or maximize efficiencies as applicable.
Identifies alternatives and actions including replacing/retiring/enhancing a solution or adjusting the organization to allow for maximum solution performance and value recognition.
Serves as a liaison between underwriting and other business areas (such as Computer Technology Services (CTS), product, actuarial, agencies, training, compliance, claims, billing, call center, client experience, etc.) and collaborates effectively.
Mentors other Business Analysts, assisting in supporting consistent business analysis practices across all projects and lines of business.



Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field preferred
Proven ability to creatively approach situations with innovative thinking
Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with all levels and business areas in the organization
Possesses effective conflict resolution skills
Strong technical aptitude, proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint). Experience with SharePoint, Azure DevOps, and Duck Creek is beneficial
Must be highly organized, self-driven, results-oriented, visionary thinker with a clear focus on quality.

Job Description



Role Summary
University of Missouri Controller’s Office provides leadership in the planning, integration, financial reporting and tax compliance for the University across all campuses and the health system. Collectively with campus colleagues, we serve as a strategic and trusted advisor, support an inclusive and dynamic culture and workforce, and pursue continuous improvement through knowledge, collaboration and leadership.

A successful candidate for this position in the Controller’s Office will:

Thrive in a fast-paced environment
Enjoy investigating problems and puzzles
Be self-motivated and proactively solve problems with little oversight
Work well as a member of a team
Understand the relationships between financial statements and systems that feed them
Proactively communicate problems and work across the organization to solve them

The Finance Information Systems team maintains the University of Missouri’s PeopleSoft Financials System and Workday Planning and is responsible for the month-end and year-end transactional processing, data reconciliation, reporting, and system maintenance and upgrades. The group provides functional expertise for the PeopleSoft modules, Web Applications, and Financial Reporting.

The Office of Finance is looking for a talented Grants and Receivables Functional Lead to join the Finance Information Systems team. This position is primarily responsible to manage, enhance, and upgrade the PeopleSoft Finance Grants Management, Billing, and Accounts Receivable modules. They provide support to the campuses/end users on the day-to-day functionality of the application and support key web user interface and reporting functions. This position will: oversee and troubleshoot system processing; lead functionality testing during upgrades; work with technical staff to identify and resolve system issues; and reconcile submodules and perform close procedures to the general ledger.

Key Responsibilities

Lead Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) business process and technology solutions for assigned modules of Grants/Project Management and Accounts Receivable/Billing. Collaborate with functional users and Information Technology (IT) staff to find solutions to business process problems. Expected to manage large, high priority and complex initiatives with significant impact on processes and financials.



Facilitate and participate in user focus groups to offer end user support. Resolve incidents and service requests logged through service management ticketing system and other channels. Complete system demonstrations, prepare needed training materials and perform training.



Coordinate the testing of patches, fixes and upgrades to the ERP system while working with impacted business users to complete thorough user acceptance testing.





Perform sub-module reconciliations to the general ledger. Ensure all required processes and integrations are occurring. Research issues and resolve the cause of any variances to ensure accurate reporting and ledger maintenance.



Support key business processes including generation of monthly and quarterly grant invoices, resolving issues with letter of credit billing, supporting departmental invoicing, and facilitating receipt of payments through various channels.





Work with auditors and management on information requests. Often involves creating new reports, writing complex SQL queries, performing data validations, summarizing large amounts of data, and providing analysis.





Solve routine to complex problems within and outside of assigned modules, taking a new perspective on existing solutions and using technical expertise/tools when necessary.





As with all positions, involvement with other duties and responsibilities may be expected to support the mission and purpose of the University of Missouri System.

Salary



Salary Range: $65,000-$80,000 per year

Grade: GGS-011

Understanding of governmental accounting standards.

Job Title: Medicare Stars Rating Business Analytics Advisor- Hybrid- TN, TX, PA, CT, MO- Cigna Healthcare
Job Description:
Job Summary:

We’re looking for a passionate Business Analytics Advisor with a deep knowledge of the Medicare Star Ratings program. We’re a Stars Analytics and Reporting team that loves to learn and push ourselves to provide meaningful insights to the business. If you’re a team player, aren’t afraid to be in front of business leaders, and have a solid core of technical skills, this is the role for you.

Data Management and Reporting Lead Analyst Job Responsibilities:

Process and maintain Cigna’s primary Medicare HEDIS Stars Reporting
Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports for Stars operations
Develop reports using self-service technologies like SQL Server Reporting Services
Report to stakeholders about changes to Stars measure methodologies and data trends
Support the management of Stars data architecture, partnering closely with matrix partners such as IT.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize efficiency and quality
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Support the development and management of version control workflows and processes, leveraging tools such as GitHub.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Act as a mentor and escalation point for other team analysts on problem solving and providing feedback and guidance on best practices.

Minimum Requirements:

Bachelors Degree or higher in Data Management, Information Systems highly preferred or equivalent amount of work experience
5 years or more work experience as a Data Analyst in Medicare Stars, specifically in operations and reporting
Work experience with process improvement
Deep understanding of coding version control best practices, GitHub workflows, and their application to analytics teams
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Knowledge of statistics and experience using data science languages (SAS, R, or Python)
5 years or more experience in database language including SQL Server and Teradata
5 years or more experience in data visualization in Tableau or Power BI
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Report writing experience in SQL server reporting services (SSRS)
